description:
Ordered delivery from here. Food arrived fresh and hot, and in a reasonable amount of time. Soup had a rich flavor and was amazing. Spring rolls were not cut but tasted good. 

Restaurant didn't provide utensils or napkins.
author: Alan H.

description:
Food took 1 hour in dine in.
Detail
Went to the restaurant for dinner with my friends (5 total). The lady took our order and brought us some water. Not sure what my other friends ordered but i had a pineapple fried rice. Don't want the review to be too long but basically from the time we entered and were seated i waited 1 hour for my food to arrive. I couldn't wait any longer so since my friends had their food come by one by one, i cancelled my order and ate the food my friends shared with me. Bad part about this was a lady came to let us know that meal was being prepped during our 1 hour wait. Basically food started coming in after 35 min or so. Lady did apologize at the end but i lost my appetite by then.
author: Saugat P.

description:
This review is only for delivery:

There are a couple options in Haight/Lower Haigh for thai food, but I like variety so I try them all. I've only gotten Ploy II for delivery so I can't speak to the service or atmosphere. In regards to their delivery, it's speedier than most Eat24 places, delivering well in their window. 

The food, is just pretty average. Nothing disappointing per say, I am full after eating the dish, but nothing that makes me want to order it again next time I'm craving thai food. One time I ordered a Tom Kha soup (I know, soup to go is the worst idea) and when it arrived, the portion was huge! It lasted me 3 meals. However, the coconut milk started separating from the broth and the soup became slightly gritty as the consistency changed. There were also a lot of pieces of galanga? or what tasted like overcooked lotus root that were very strange. I wasn't sure if they were edible or not based on how they looked, but I ate them anyway and I have survived. 

With their pad thai and other noodle dishes being just average and me having an unusual experience with their soup, it'll probably be a while before I order from Ploy again. Or maybe next time I won't be lazy and actually eat in the restaurant!
author: Barbara C.

description:
There are a few Thai restaurants on Haight street but none as cozy as this one.

Ploy II is located in a converted Victorian apartment and you feel like you are dining at a friend's house instead of a restaurant. The fireplace is still present (not sure if it still works) and all sorts of homey Thai decorations and random Christmas tinsel garlands adorns the walls.  I've taken a few different people here and they always ask me how I found this place.

The food its typical Thai fare.  I'd recommend the Basil chicken or the Pumpkin Curry which is rich, smooth, and fills you up fast so you can always get leftovers.  

I like the tables that overlook Haight Street for people watching, but they can be hard to snag if the restaurant is busy.
author: Joan W.

description:
If you weren't on the search for thai food or just to grab a bite in general, this is a place thats definitely easy to miss. A little walk up some steps and you're greeted by a cozy atmosphere that others might think of as cramped. I like to think of it as my grandma's lil' cramped, homey apartment. Same vibes going on here. With that being said, if the place is full, it'll get awkward to try to walk by other tables, with your booty lightly grazing the backs of strangers chairs. For the time I went, it wasn't a huge problem since we were the only ones in the restaurant. 

My party of 8 ordered our food and the whole staff seemed to disappear. We were seated right by the kitchen which we can directly see into and we saw everyone sitting around watching an asian drama and eating. Half an hour goes by. Nothing. 40 minutes go by. Then we see someone get up and start cooking and then all of our food comes out in 10 more minutes. Like I said, we were the only ones there, so the meal would've been more enjoyable if they didn't keep us waiting or at least pretended they were cooking by checking on us to refill our empty waters.

I will give it to them that their pad see ew was some of the best I've had. However the crazy wait was not worth it, sadly, so hopefully it'll be better next time!
author: Maleah M.

description: I went here on a Bumble BFF meet-up because I found a new friend there that's also obsessed with thai food and we wanted to try a new place. The food was amazing, and the location - right on Haight Ashbury - was great for walking around post-dinner! Definitely one of my favorite spots now and will use for future meet-ups.
author: Rhea C.

description:
I came here on a Saturday evening to meet up with some friends. We were a party of 17 but my friend was able to secure a reservation ahead of time. They seated us upstairs in a semi-private room, which worked out well so we could still all talk to each other. We were split into 2 long tables. 

The restaurant is inside a cute Victorian house in Haight area. The sign doesn't pop out so you may easily walk pass it if you weren't keeping an eye out! They put their ginormous menu on the outside of door so you can take a peek to see if anything catches your eye before going inside.

For my table, we started off by sharing some appetizers -- SPICY TOFU, FRIED TOFU, and SPICY CHICKEN WINGS. Both tofu dishes were very flavorful! I loved the peanut sauce that came with the fried tofu. But the spicy tofu was our table's favorite because of the sweet and spicy sauce that covered the crispy outsides of the tofu pieces. I think the same sauce were used for the chicken wings too. They left the tips of chicken wings on so it was a bit harder to eat, but still very flavorful. 

For my entree, I split the CRAB NOODLES with my boyfriend. Their portions are really big so I'm glad we split this! The noodles were tender and evenly covered with sauce. You could taste the "wok flavor," which is hard to accomplish at home. I would like this even more if the crab pieces were bigger. My friends had the PAD SEE YEW (with chicken and beef), TOM YUM SOUP, SPICY FISH FILLET, YELLOW CURRY and ROASTED DUCK OVER SPINACH. We all pretty much finished all our food and were very satisfied. A few of us also got the THAI ICED TEA and it was sweet but not overbearing. 

Their service for our large party was good -- our drinks were refilled promptly and they didn't hesitate to bring us chili paste and other condiments when requested. However, the timing of the food was a bit staggered. At my table, my boyfriend and I were the last to receive our entree even though we ordered first. And our second table started to get their food even though they ordered 10 minutes after us. But we eventually got all the food and spent lots of time chatting to catch up, so the timing of the food didn't pose too much of an issue.

Note that they automatically include gratuity for big parties. They also write out all orders in Thai on the receipt, so make sure you double-check if you received all your food orders.  One of our tables didn't get their fresh spring roll and a tofu dish and had to remind waitress to not include those charges, since we couldn't tell if they wrote it on receipt.

I'd come back here again especially if I had a large group and wanted to eat near Golden Gate Park.
author: Bonnie Z.

description: Fucking terrible. Seriously waited two hours for food. Then I had to make a scene to get my money back so I could go to another restaurant for food. Do not go here. I've never had such a terrible experience
author: Ashok R.

description:
My favorite Thai place in SF so far! The food is solid but what I really like is the ambiance and feel of the restaurant. It's a converted Victorian house which makes it very unique, and reminds me of X-ing in Washington DC. What also makes the ambiance more unique is the Thai music and decor... for an interesting Thai-Victorian feel.

I've gotten the pad Thai, pad kee mao, Tom yum noodle soup and curry. All are really good, the Tom yum is probably better without noodles though. Fantastic Thai iced tea and mango sticky rice desert. 

The main reason that I knocked off a star is because the bill was $96 and they rounded it up to $100. They corrected it when we asked but that seemed odd. Also, it's difficult to read the bill handwriting - nitpicky stuff.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Tasty food, relaxed experience. A bit pricey but not bad for SF. I suggest the crab rangoon for starters and the pad se ew
author: Paul S.

description: We came to eat here twice this week and don't know why it's not busier.  The people we brought to eat with had lived in Thailand.  They were impressed with the quality of the food.  The portions are good and service even better,  just like in Thailand, gentle and patient.  We will come back more often as a go to place to get reasonably priced Thai food with great tasting dishes.
author: Linda H.

description:
I found food here to be tasty and inexpensive yet quite oily.

At $12.95 the lunch combinations beginning at 12:00pm through 3:00pm are reasonably priced and satisfying.

At $12.95 I tried the Spicy Prawns and Corncakes lunch combo, which came with a cup of the daily soup. Today, it was coconut-based and delicious. The entre arrived with a generous helping of white rice. The Spicy Prawns were mixed with red bell pepper and green beans. Although they were really quite tasty they were swimming in oil. The Corncakes arrived fried to a light crisp with a sweet dipping sauce.

We also tried the $12.95 Pad See Ew and Egg Rolls lunch combo. This was a beef and wide noodle dish similar to a Chow Fun. Also with soup but no rice or corncakes, rather Egg Rolls. This too was quite tasty and satisfying yet again overly oily.

We may try the curries next time around they should require the use of so much oil.
author: Caesar A.

description: This is my favorite place to get really authentic thai dish.  They just update their menu recently, my meal that i order was crispy chicken over garlic rice ( chicken 's so crunchy outside and soft inside , going well with garlic rice which smell so so good)  ,  and mussel pancake or we call hoy-tod  ( it's crispy and tasty , come with hot sweet red sauce)  . It was fantastic and remind me of my hometown.  I have brought many friends to this restaurant, and they all fall in love to this place.  If you are looking for original and real Thai food , Must try this place.
author: Khorawon P.

description:
Overall, a good neighborhood Thai spot if you're in the area. I have had takeout from here multiple times but this was my first dine-in experience. Based on the service, I am inclined to recommend it as a takeout spot over dine-in.

I went with a group of friends and we got several items to share - papaya salad, pad kee noodles, eggplant, red curry, and the tom kha soup (all vegetarian). The papaya salad was decent but I don't think good enough to order again. I would recommend the noodles and the curry. I especially liked the cute fish dish the curry came in that allowed you to pour the sauce over your rice.

The prices are what you would expect and fair by SF standards. They do have great cheap wine options. It was very busy when we went and the servers were definitely working hard, but there was just not enough staff for the amount of patrons. We waited a very long time to order, get our food, and pay, so if you want to eat at the restaurant, be prepared for a leisurely meal! We were happy to be seated right away as a party of 6 on a Sunday evening. If I am craving Thai in the Haight I would go back, but wouldn't travel from a different 'hood.
author: Gabriela R.

description: So...here we go....The food is very mediocre (literally had to beg the waitress for chili, salt, and lime). Then, 10 minutes later, they demanded we leave because of my small service dog. He's fully trained, makes no noise, and were told it would be fine upon arrival. Since I lived in Thailand, I tried to talk to the waitress about service animal rights, but it was a lost cause. Conclusion: the service is surprisingly worse than the food.
author: Arya A.

description:
Great food & cute place!! 

The Tom yum soup is good & the shrimp too!! 

Chicken satay is YUM & the soup is delicious!!!!
author: Zoe Y.

description:
Note: this is a takeout review. Maybe it's better for dine in, maybe not. Who knows. Idk if I'll give them another chance. 

Got takeout from here over the weekend. We ordered the calamari salad, crab noodle, salmon filet peanut sauce, and mango coconut rice dessert situation. Surface level, how amazing does that sound, right?? 

Ordered from Yelp24 and waited over an hour for our food to arrive. Honestly, with the amount of food apps out there, how has Yelp24 not gotten any better? All the other ones give you real time updates. Yelp24 gives you a countdown to an unreal time...sorry for the Yelp24 tangent, but maybe it was tied to the restaurant's take out issue as well. Said the food would arrive by 7:40pm (over an hour past our order time). That was a lie. Called Yelp24 at 8pm, and they said it was FINALLY on its way. Fine, fine. Warriors game night. I get it. 

Anyways, the food overall was not good...not like it wasn't fresh(ish) ingredients, but nothing had any flavor???? Starting with the calamari salad...it was straight up a handful of calamari pieces on top of two huge chunks of lettuce. Uhhh ok. The crab noodle had zero flavor...plus, where was the crab?! It was like a flavorless pad Thai without crab meat! Uhhh ok. Then the salmon filet peanut sauce just confused the hell out of me. Salmon was goodish. Peanut sauce was flavorful. Both things together? Tasted like both things were battling it out and neither won. Uhhh no. THEN the mango coconut rice...supposed to be the star of the show, right?! I couldn't even get past one bite. The mango was not right and the rice was literally a pile of mush.

Delivery - 2
Food - 2 (that's being generous)
author: Jennifer L.

description:
TL;DR: fast, free delivery, yummy pad thai!
Delivery: 5 stars
Pad thai: 4 stars (would love to try it fresh)
Pad see ew: 2 stars

We ordered 2 dishes for delivery via Yelp's eat24 at dinner time, expecting it to take 45-60 minutes as advertised, so we were pleasantly surprised when the food showed up in 20 minutes! Also, ordering on yelp directly was super convenient. 
We didn't get any utensils though, so if you want utensils, you should probably write additional instructions on the order to ask for them! Wasn't an issue for me though. 

We ordered a pad thai with beef and a pad see ew with pork. I thought the pad thai surprisingly had a lot of flavor! It was honestly one of the better delivery food experiences I've had, because usually not having the food fresh spoils it. 

However, I wasn't a huge fan of the pad see ew. I usually love the dish, but I thought this one lacked flavor and was a bit oily. I didn't finish it, and when I reheated it a couple days later, it still tasted the same, pretty bland. 

I would order from here again! But I would probably just stick with the pad thai next time.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
Definitely that little hole in the wall that I've seen, walked past, and didn't think anything of it. I decided to stop by and dine in since I had seen this place so many times. It's upstairs with windows facing Haight, and it's nice! It's clean and modern, and there were cute drawing and signs on the walls.

The staff were super friendly and greeted me upon entry and made sure I wasn't waiting for anything. I had a seat next to the window, so that lunch time sunshine was PERFECT. 

I ordered the pad see ew (ik ik, basic af) and it was super good! Not too greasy, the noodles weren't overcooked, AND the coconut curry that accompanied it was amazing. I've definitely found a new go-to thai place in the area, and I'll be returning!!

Food: 9/10
Staff: 9/10
Atmosphere: 10/10
Value: 9/10
Overall: 9.25/10
author: Evan K.

description: WARNING this place is ridiculously overrated. Let's talk about the food first. It was good, but all in all it was pretty standard thai food you could probably get somewhere else. Prices were pretty standard, nothing too crazy pricey. If I had no other problems with the place I probably would have gone back. BUT the service is absolutely GARBAGE. We were seated pretty quickly, however it took 15 minutes just to get water, then another 15 for them to take our order. After our order was sent back we had to wait another whopping hour long before we received our food. In what world is this service acceptable? We had seen other customers who were seated AFTER us get their food prior to us. When I asked a server she apologized and just said they had been busy. All in all, if you're here for lunch or something and there's not a crowd, not a bad place. However I would go other places first.
author: Sofie L.

description: 5/5 stars for awesome authentic Thai food! Crab ragoons, chicken satay, and vegetarian curry puffs all recommended for appetizers. Pad kee mao (drunken noodles), pad thai, and fried rice also all recommended. If you're looking for delicious thai food, come here! I've had Thai from many places and only one where I'm from back home in NY is worth the trip. This place is where it's at! Highly recommended. Also the food may take a little bit, but that's how you know everything is made fresh (it's worth the wait)
author: Emily M.

description:
Where's Poly I?? Regardless...Authentic Thai food and dining experience! Hidden germ of the Haight. 

[FOOD]
- PAD THAI [5/5]: Recommend seafood combo! Perfect dosage of sweetness and sour, complimented by peanut crumbles! Reasonable portion size for a hearty meal. RECOMMEND THIS DISH if you prefer something on the sweet side and is HUNGRY. :D

- PAD SEE EW [4/5]: Good proportion of veggies, meat, and noodles. Nothing too extraordinary but still very delicious. 

- PO TAK [2/5]: Very sour soup with a compilation of seafood. It's refreshing but I personally didn't like the taste, especially when mixed with seafood. 

- MANGO PANANG CURRY [4/5]: YUM! Huge pieces of mango and meat. They pour coconut milk right on top. The curry is a little more runny than I would have liked, but was still delicious with rice. (Rice is not complimentary; need to order on side)

- ROASTED DUCK SALAD [3/5]: Didn't taste too much of the duck meat. The dish was also a bit too acidic/sour for my taste. 

[SETTING]
I love the atmosphere at this place. Even though the place is a bit crammed, you can tell the restaurant put in effort in the decorations and staff outfits to make this an authentic dinning experience. Extremely friendly service.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Amongst all the storefronts within the vicinity of Haight and Ashbury, you'll find the hidden gem that is Ploy. I've been to a few thai spots in the city, but nominate this one as the best. Perfect for family style dining, or just if your exceptionally hungry, as the portions are as generous as the staff that works there. 

 Sitting upstairs allows you a nice view of the area, evening more so as the lights illuminate the area. Despite the cramped quarters, it never feels that way even when busy. Decor is simple and the dining experience as a whole feels more so like you're going over to your Aunt or Grandma's place. It's extremely comfortable, and cozy, all the while the staff keeps that feeling going.

Food is fresh and delicious, I recommend the papaya and roasted duck as a personal favorite. Thai spices never disappoint, so if you don't favor spicy options, stay away from those double chilli pepper menu items.

All in all, this is my favorite thai place to dine even if you're not a huge fan of the area. Despite how you feel about the area, definitely stop in for a bite here!
author: Justin N.

description: This is our favorite Thai place in the city - for delivery and to dine in. The best Pad See-Ew and curries!
author: Grasshopper R.

description: Dependable thai delivery. Pad see ew, yellow curry, and crab rangoon are my favorites. The chicken satay is good, too.
author: Jackie O.

description:
Cute little place that makes you feel like you're upstairs in somebody's apartment. Maybe eight tables but attentive service and good/expected if not outstanding food.

Had the Pra Ram tofu over broccoli and spinach which was good but a little sweet and Thai iced tea which also needed a bit of watering down.

Overall good spot, but don't expect too much and enjoy all the handwritten signs on the walls. I particularly like the one that says if you don't tell them about your food allergies they are not responsible for the consequences.
author: Bob K.

description: Unfortunately we came here for lunch. The Panang Curry was chalky, they forgot to bring our soup , no water refills and we had to wait 15 for our bill. However the staff was very sweet
author: Mark N.

description: This is a Haight special edition. It's like walking into someone's house, but if their house was made into a restaurant. Before you let that turn you off. Have seat, it's a bit cramped... I know you're thinking this could go bad, but trust me...have seat. Chat with the neighboring table. Relax and when the food comes, you'll thank me. Oh, don't forget to try some of their inexpensive wine by the glass.
author: Stafford J.

description:
I went here for the third time and I feel like I have to write a review for this restaurant.
First visit
Me: Pineapple Fried Rice
My cousin: Curry with Chicken

Second visit
Me: Thai Fried Rice with chicken
My friend: Pad Thai

Third visit
Me: Fried Chicken with sweet and sour sauce over rice
My friend: Panang curry with beef

First visit, it was okay.
Second, it was good.
But third, our food is SO GOOD.
well, the beef was good and yummy.
The fried chicken was tasty and tender, but the Fried Chicken in Osha is better.
author: Candice L.

description:
Hands down the best Thai food I've had in quite a while.   I got the MIENG KUM which was superb, the SPICY TOFU also fantastic, the beef PARAM DERN DUONG which was quite tasty as well.   

Delivery was quick, friendly and the food was still hot!
author: Matt V.

description: Awesome Thai food. Had the pad Thai (really good), spicy eggplant (also very good), and pad kee mow (probably least favorite but still good),. Will be returning!
author: Rosie C.

description: Kinda sketchy looking, wasn't sure about it and two hipsters came out and said eat here its fantastic! So we went up. I wasn't that hungry so I ordered a beef salad and my boyfriend ordered garlic beef and a side of rice. The beef salad had such a great flavor! My boyfriend didn't really like his and said he wish he had ordered what I had. The sodas come in a can and the service was iffy. But overall not bad.
author: Holly C.

description: I always order takeout or dine in here when I'm in the city. Very authentic Thai food, service is great and timely, and food is always consistent. I can't go without ordering the crab Thai fried rice, panang, chicken satay, and mango sticky rice. Absolute favorite spot on Haight!
author: Sharey V.

description: This is probably my go to Thai place. Their shrimp pad Thai is one my fave as well as the chicken with fried rice. As for appetizers their spicy tofu is very good. I've also tried their egg rolls and calamari but I think for the price it's better to get the spicy tofu. You get more for your money. Overall, I love ploy II! Their main dishes are really good and something I can order everyday. I think there was a point where I ordered from this place for a whole week. They have free delivery if your order is  $20 or more. Really nice delivery guys also.
author: Patricia M.

description:
never disappoints. from the decor to the yummy food. i've been gong here for years and have never had a bad experience. i like also that the resto is upstairs, a bit off "the beaten track" and if you're lucky enough to get a window seat it's a nice way to view the haight street action.

just, yes!
author: Wendy X.

description: Moved from the Haight to North Beach a year ago and the two things I miss most are Haight St Market and Ploy II. Best peanut sauce I've ever had, hands down. I recommend getting an extra order of it and the fresh veggie rolls and dunking them in it -- heaven. Curries are solid, have heard the soups are good but usually ordered the pad Thai and curries myself. They won't mock you for asking for things mild (but make sure to ask!).
author: Amelia Q.

description: Delivery is extremely slow! Our order took 2.5 hours!
author: Lizzie L.

description:
Details of Arrival:
- Tuesday night, 8pm
- no wait
- moderately busy
- cool upstairs homestyle decor

Food:
- Tom yum veggie soup
- corn pancake
- panang curry

Food wasn't bad, average Thai food. But reviews for the slow service are very true. We were sat immediately, but they made us wait 25 minutes to take our order.  Then as other reviews said, the food too a long time to come out. I'd say generally, Thai food shouldn't take THAT long. Correct me if I'm wrong. Took over an hour since seating for our main course (curry) to arrive and they never checked in with us. But they filled up water when we asked.... I've had plenty of time to write this review. 

If you come here, expect to wait or have lots of time on your hands.
author: Justin Y.

description: Some of the best thai food I've had since Thailand. What else do you want? Oh sure, it is also extremely reasonably priced. Go here. No wait... don't go I want it all to myself!
author: Greg F.

description:
Went with my extended family -6 people. It was very very crowded, got an interim seating.
We were very clear from the beginning that we are vegetarians and don't want any meat or even egg or its smell in our food.
The Tom Kha soup was great,  the veggie curries were all much sweeter than usual. 
The Pad Thai however had chicken in it and we had to return in. 

To be fair, they did apologize for it but I get really annoyed when restaurants take food preferences casually. 

All restaurants MUST understand that being vegetarian is a part of some people's religion and eating non vegetarian food even once even accidentally is a potential sin. 
I'm not religious but my in-laws are and it completely spoilt their experience
author: Praveer C.

description:
I ordered take out via Yelp. The restaurant is in the cute Haight-Ashbury neighborhood, and upon going up the stairs, it looks like you're going into someone's apartment. 

If I were entertaining a guest, I probably would not choose this place to dine in. 

Regardless, they had my order ready in a timely manner, which I was pleased about because it was raining outside and I wanted to get a move on in my night. The chicken pad thai was a solid 3/5, not bad, but definitely not memorable enough for me to travel west of Divisadero to eat. 

I'd also pass on the fresh spring rolls....it came in a plastic take-out container wrapped in saran wrap, making me think it was not so fresh. Save this dish for Vietnamese places.
author: Liz Y.

description: Pad Thai was pretty terrible and half of it was burnt.  Not fresh, not good flavor. The delivery time was 45 mins longer than the 60 min estimate.
author: Jasmine M.

description:
I came here for dinner with a friend, and we ended up ordering papaya salad, red curry, and tom yum soup. I was visiting SF for a short stay, so if you're touring SF I wouldn't recommend it as a super "San Francisco" place to go, but it was pretty standard Thai fare at what I considered fair prices.

The service was nice and there were actually plenty of people eating there around dinner time, but I don't think I was honestly blown-away by anything I ate. Nothing surprising. Portions were pretty decent, and the interior was cute in an odd, random sort of way.....
author: Diane J.

description: Not bad at all for the price, portions were nice and large. I enjoyed my chicken pad thai and my husband enjoyed his pineapple fried rice. Additionally, the imperial thai egg rolls for an appetizer were delicious!! Would definitely order again.
author: Daniella J.

description: Ordered delivery off Eat24.  I probably won't order from them again.  We had Pad See Ew, Pad Thai, and Green Curry.  It took about an hour for delivery.  Pad See Ew was so under flavored but the beef was so overcooked. Pad Thai was ok but lacking in flavor. The best item out of the three was the curry since it had the most flavor and had a lot of veggies and meat.
author: Melissa T.

description:
Ordered take out during the storm and everything about this order was unacceptable. These are the events that transpired. 

The order took 2 hours to be prepared and delivered. I ordered 4 items via EAT24 at 5:10pm and the order was not delivered until 7:20pm. EAT24 estimated order delivery  at 6:28pm. 
When I called the restaurant to check on the order, the staff did not answer the phone for over 10 min .Finally, at 6:45pm I managed to get them to pick up and I inquired about the order. Despite the fact the the order was already late, the staff was not helpful and did not even apologize, citing the storm was causing a delay and said order would arrive at 7pm. 

When the order finally arrived at 7:20pm, every plastic container holding the food was either broken or shattered. The worse was the Pad See Ew which was leaking into the bag and on everything else. Trying to salvage whatever was left of it, just made it worse and the broken plastic just mixed into the food and it became inedible. 

I called the restaurant Immediately to complain about delivery time but mostly about the packaging of the order and again, the staff was not helpful nor did they believe what I was claiming. Instead of taking responsibility or apologizing, they insinuated that my phone number in their system might have been the cause of the delay, even thought I called 35 min earlier and they mentioned nothing about it. At this point, I was pissed as I could not eat the food and it was already over 2 HOURS after I placed the order. 
As a result, I asked for a refund due to the unacceptable wait time and the broken containers, the staff said they would call me back after consulting with the manager. 10 minutes later, the manager called back and asked me to pack the food (in the broken container!?!) as they are interested in coming picking it up.
 
Less than 10 min later, the manger and one of his staff members showed up at my door step asking to see the packaging and the food. I placed the food and whatever was left from the container in the bag they deliver it and handed it over to the manager. They immediately asked for the rest of the food (Seriously?!) and instead I showed them the pictures and video I took with my phone, once I noticed the condition of the order once it was delivered. 

After seeing the status of the bag, the pictures and video, the manager refunded the money back but at this point the damage was already done, mostly due to their attitude from the get go.

Despite the refund, I am just speechless that they asked to see the rest of the food as if I was lying. I will not make an order or walk into this place again.
author: Gil B.

description:
I love Ploy II and have decidedly made it my favorite Thai restaurant in SF. Here's why:

- It is genuinely authentic to Haight-Ashbury culture. Located upstairs in an old victorian over-looking Haight St, it has just the right amount of wacky SF charm. Carpeted floors, hand-written signage, christmas lights, and kitsch Valentine's decorations make this restaurant really endearing. 

- The food is bomb. I've had the panang curry with shrimp, papaya salad, chicken pad see ew, and duck breast curry and I would eat all of them again for breakfast the next morning - in fact, I did. I'm still day dreaming about the pad see ew from last night and strongly considering going back tonight. It's THAT good. 

- Good service, not crowded. Granted, I have only been to Ploy II on rainy days (also, perfect hot Thai food days) but I've never had to wait and always had attentive service. 

I'm all-in on Ploy II, but like other reviewers I want to know - what happened to Ploy I?
author: Stephanie D.

description:
My roommate gave me the thumbs up for this place, despite the health score. We decided to say eff it - we'll take our chances! (we were really craving thai food and this was the closest place)

I got chicken pad thai. I can't say I've ever had a bad pad thai so I guess you could say I'm always on the hunt for a memorable pad thai. In regards to portion, they give you a lot. I read someones review saying that when you get it to-go you get more and perhaps that's true because I had enough for two full meals.

Negative star because I asked for it to be spicy and repeated it twice and it had zero spice. That's always my biggest issue with thai places - they never actually make it spicy when I request. 

Also the lady I order from on the phone spoke so fast and hardly listened, I wasn't sure she got our order. They did call when it was ready for pick up which was nice. Only took about 15 minutes for it to be ready. 

But, not major complaints. I'm likely to come back next time I've got a thai craving again!
author: Kelly G.

description: We ordered delivery so I can only recommend the food. We ordered 3 dishes, all of which were great. Our favorite was the green curry chicken. We got medium spicy which was perfect...just a little kick. The dish sizes were large. We had 3 people and really only needed 2 dishes. We were very happy with everything and would recommend Ploy II to anyone!
author: Harris C.

description:
My bf and I just ordered delivery from here. The food arrived an hour and a half later & cold. Plus, the order was incomplete. When we called Ploy to ask them to bring the remainder of the order, they refused. So now my bf had to go to the restaurant to collect. 

This was incredibly disappointing experience and I'm requesting a complete refund from Eat24.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Amazing Thai food!! I tried the pad thai, the spicy chicken wings, and spicy noodles and everything was great, but the pad thai was a true standout. It was one of the best pad thais I have ever had. Beers here are super cheap, too - $4!! It's clear that once upon a time this restaurant used to be a home, but it's really cute. Ploy II is a must-try and better than all the other Thai I've had in the neighborhood. 

Where is Ploy I???
author: Cynthia S.

description:
Best Thai in San Francisco so far. Really. 
We have tried several dishes from the menu,  and it was always delicious. 
Their pad Thai is amazing,  and all other noodle dishes we have tried so far were tasty.  The amount served is too much for me, but hey, who doesn't like a to go box for the next day? 
I love the fact that they have young coconut,  I love those!  It gives  a special atmosphere to a dinner :) 
The Victorian style is cutely married with thai decoration,  and I specially appreciate the small table they have in font of the window...  It gets really romantic at night with the lights ^^
 I have to add that once this place was closed, so we gave a try to Siam lotus just across the street.. And omg what such an error... the most awful thai food experience in our life!  
So yes, go to ploy II and enjoy!
author: Adelaide B.

description:
Love the old school environment of this place, love the location, love the food, and love the huge portions. The service is always extremely pleasant. I've never had a bad experience here and the only thing that makes me sad is that they sometimes go on well-deserved vacations and close. 

I give it 10 thumbs up!
author: Brad C.

description:
*Review for delivery via Eat24*

Ploy II is my go-to for Thai delivery. Solid flavors, good portions, and the delivery comes piping hot and on time. My favorite dish is the Pad Kee Mao, best in the neighborhood.

They do tend to the less spicy side. I'm nowhere near being a curry heat champ, and I get their hottest option for the Red Curry. If you like heat, give special instruction.

They're not open late so plan ahead!
author: Matthew K.

description: This place is very cute and service is friendly. Came here for lunch because I was in the area. Unfortunately the reviews are very inflated and I was disappointed with the food. Everything tastes ok but nothing was great and flavors were on the bland side - we had pad see ew, chicken wings, fried taro, and the coconut milk soup. Maybe we didn't order the right stuff but I generally really like pad see ew. I much prefer Marnee Thai.
author: Erin C.

description: Just my favorite neighborhood Thai place. Cheap prices, great service, neighborhood staple.
author: Doxie M.

description: My husband and I cannot get enough of Ploy's red, green, and pannag pumpkin curry as well as their spicy eggplant basil. SO GOOD! I can't speak to any of their other dishes, because I haven't really ventured past the curries, but their fried pumpkin and spring rolls are delicious. If I could eat here every day, I probably would.
author: Christy T.

description: MY FAVORITE THAI PLACE IN THE WORLD. Try the fried rice and the duck curry. You won't regret it!!!
author: Lola C.

description: The kind of secret little place that make cities great. It's upstairs, in a converted apartment. Everyone who works there is Thai. The food is so good! I love the mango panang curry and the pad kee mao.
author: Ashley M.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for a late lunch on a sunny day and found the restaurant relatively quiet. The restaurant, as many other reviews have mentioned, appears to be a converted apartment. The atmosphere very cozy and the sunlight was shining through the large windows that point towards the bustling Haight street. Scattered along the walls are handwritten signs such as "Thai ice tea with free refills" and a variety of Thai decorations. One plus is that they have free delivery with a minimum $20 order, which we have utilized twice before visiting the actual store.

The Pad See Ew with Beef is AMAZING. This is my go-to order at any Thai place and Ploy II's pad see ew is the best I've ever had. The noodles are a slightly chewier consistency than usual and is the reason the dish is so delicious. The beef is a little overcooked, but regardless delicious and a good complement to the noodles. The portion size is also quite significant, which is always a plus.

Another great find was the Mango Panang Curry with chicken, which is actually not on the normal menu (but is on the picture menu). This curry sauce was infused with mango, creating a unique blend of flavors, and with several cuts of mango itself. Ask your waiter/waitress to add mango to the panang curry, which is an extra $2! 

We've also tried the Green Curry with Chicken, which was okay. It does not stand out from any other Thai curry dish I've ever eaten, but honestly is still delicious and was quickly finished. The portion size was a lot smaller than the pad see ew. 

Pad Thai with Chicken is another one of my favorites Thai dishes. My boyfriend thought Ploy II's dish was better than the green curry, though I felt the noodles seemed a little under-cooked. There is not as much chicken as I would have thought, though does come with tofu and egg as well. The portion size is about the same as the Pad See Ew.

Overall: Ploy II is an authentic, solid Thai restaurant. I will 100% be back (or reorder) the Pad See Ew again and possibly the Mango Panang Curry. The Green Curry and Pad Thai were simply okay and I recommend venturing beyond these staple dishes.
author: Vivian L.

description: Food was fine. I was with a big group, and when bill came, the food total was $180, but the total was ~$250. They didn't tell us a tip was included, nor did the receipt. When we did the math their implied gratuity was over 20%.
author: Robert L.

description: Had the chicken Pad See Ewe and it was phenomenal. It was a hot day in SF today, and as expected every building in Haight  was scorching. The staff was super accommodating!
author: Josh E.

description: This is such a cute little hidden gem!  Everything I've tried here I've loved.  The appetizer chicken skewers, tom kha, and the chicken and broccoli are some of my favorites!
author: Talia C.

description:
Came here on a late Friday night (around 9pm) after a solid happy hour with lots of wine, so we were looking for some good Thai food to satiate our quest for drunk food ;)

Luckily, we found Ploy II just a few blocks away and stumbled in. It's a bit of a hole in the wall (you have to walk up the stairs and the restaurant feels more like dining at someone's home--not necessarily a bad thing). 

There were three of us and we got seated immediately. We ordered a few appetizers to split, the calamari and the spring rolls, and a few noodle and rice dishes family-style. 

Everything came out rather quickly. The calamari was pretty good--crispy and hot. The spring rolls were okay, but not something I'm dreaming about. 

The entrees were also just pretty average--the pineapple fried rice was kind of bland and flavorless and the noodles weren't too special either. A little disappointing honestly but it got the job done
author: Jay P.

description:
We walked around Haight street and started craving Thai food. The only concern I ever have with eating Thai/Chinese/Vietnamese food is that they load up their food with MSG. I have a tough time breathing after eating meals with that stuff In there.

Before being seated, I asked if they use Msg in their food. They do! But you can request that they leave it out of your dish. Msg is sprinkled on food as a flavor enhancer. It looks just like salt. 

We ordered the chicken pad thai, drunken noodles, chicken larb, and sticky rice and mango for dessert. Food was really good, I definitely needed the thai chili sauce to compliment my meal. Then came the dessert. The mango wasn't ripe, which is how it's supposed to be. It's not mango season so you can't really blame them.

Very friendly staff, bathroom was clean, prices ranged from 7- 11 dollars per dish. Appetizers are a little cheaper. We'll be going back there soon!
author: Jack D.

description: So, so good. Many of my friends' and my favorite Thai spot in SF. Def get the pad see ew!
author: Jess L.

description: Not sure how this place has 4 stars as the food was mediocre at best, the service below subpar, and watch out for the owners' daughter (and I'm assuming she is because she was the only wait staff that wasn't in uniform.) Anytime we asked for something, she gave us an attitude. First and last time there.
author: Sai T.

description:
My favorite Thai restaurant! It looks crazy inside. Tons of hand written signs everywhere all DO NOT ENTER. SPECIALS. THAI ICED TEA. WE ARE NOT RESPONSIBLE IF YOU CHOKE ON A PEANUT. Random parts of the restaurant are closed off and it is quite hot and cramped inside. 

None of this matters though because the food here is bomb! Got the eggplant, mango curry and the pumpkin curry with brown rice. I'm writing this review while on a juice detox and realizing how horrible of an idea this is. Wahhhhh. 

Definitely looking forward to coming back here!!!!
author: Tiffany V.

description:
TL;DR: Easy to get in at 8:30-9:00PM; Good service; Homely decor; good salads; Spicy fish isn't so fresh. 

I called ahead, but there was no need, it was half-full at 8:55 PM so the server didn't ask us for our names. 

You arrive at what looks like another house on Haight street, go up, and presto! It's a Thai restaurant. It's like eating at their personal home. 

We ordered:
Beef salad - well prepared, good amount of cold beef strips, with mint, onions and that Thai sauce. 

Som tum (papaya salad) - less sweet and less spicy than what I like. I guess everybody has their own definition for what is "medium spicy"

Spicy fish - this one has a lot of potential. It's a battered fried fish filet in yummy black tangy sauce. Unfortunately, the fish didn't feel fresh enough, and you can feel it even through the batter.  Nobody likes stale fish. 

Overall the portions were pretty big IMO.
author: Omer G.

description: The pad thai was really good, a bigger portion than usual but that just meant plenty of leftovers.
author: Celeste D.

description: Pretty disappointing  I truly don't understand the great reviews unless they are from tourist or SF transplants? I stuck with a safe standard red chicken curry it was  really watery had a lot of spice but no flavor. Oh well you can't win them all, but thankfully  there are many amazing Thai places in this city especially in the TL
author: Susan S.

description: Tom Yum was really underwhelming. No real flavor to it at all and the veggies were really over done. Pad See Yue was ok but wasn't a lot of pork compared to other places I've tried. Pineapple fried rice was pretty good
author: Paul W.

description: This place was recommended by a friend and I'm not sure why. The food was basic but the service was god awful. The total on mine and a friends food was $33.80 when we got there we handed the woman $38. Then she tells us to have a good day. She tipped herself. Then she wanted to be stingy about giving us chop sticks. Never again.
author: Eduardo C.

description: The cutest and most amazing Thai restaurant in San Francisco! The service is wonderful and the food is delicious. The whole experience is very authentic. Tucked away on the top floor of a cozy house in the Haight, You won't find better Thai food anywhere. I love the crispy fried tofu with basil. To me, it's their speciality. I haven't seen it anywhere else. Lucky are those who make it here.
author: Crystal Y.

description: This place is your classic upstairs Thai restaurant. It reminded me of this place I would go to in Hanover NH called Thai Orchid /Mai Thai; it was also on the second floor and had ugly, clashing interior decorations. The food is pretty cheap, good portions. Service was fine too, expect we had three different waitresses for some reason. I wouldn't come here if you are touring haight-ashbury bc it's a bit random and not as good as cha cha cha, which is Peruvian and just down the street and more "haight" - if you know what I mean.
author: Juliana P.

description:
An "only in SF" experience with regards to its interior, Ploy II serves classic Thai fare in a converted restaurant that clearly once was a large upstairs Haight-Ashbury apartment. You open the door, immediately walk up a set of stairs, and are seated in what was once someone's large carpeted living room and dining room. The kitchen, visible from your table, also clearly once was someone's apartment kitchen, not an industrial sized restaurant kitchen. 

Ploy II's health score is on the low end, probably because they're prepping, cooking, and storing everything in an apartment, not a restaurant kitchen, but I've never gotten sick in the handful of times I have eaten here. That having been said the tables, carpeted eating area, and bathroom are all a bit worn out and dirty. But that's pretty typical for hole-in-the-wall restaurants in SF. 

Ploy II's food is okay, but really I've found nothing special. They have all of the typical Thai restaurant dishes you can imagine: various curries, pad thai, pad see ew, larb, tom kha, chicken satay, etc. IMO the yellow curry with a side of steamed rice is probably the best dish I've had at Ploy II. Ordered the tom kha noodle soup and was seriously disappointed the broth was watery and bland, no flavor! Chicken satay is on par here: nice large pieces of chicken on a skewer with a bomb peanut dipping sauce. 

If you're new to Thai food or just have never had better you might think Ploy II is pretty good but Ploy II just falls a little short of a lot of the other local Thai places. Personally I prefer Thai Time, King's Thai, and Pagan to Ploy II as I feel their interpretation and presentation of the same classic Thai dishes to be superior to Ploy II's. 

+1 Star *Unique hole-in-the-wall SF experience
+1 Star *Cheap
+1 Star* LARGE Portions! 

-1 Star* Same dishes are better at other SF Thai places
-1 Star* A little dirty
author: Tomas K.

description: They got my order wrong, and I called them back to have my card credited and they never did. They serve ice out of a gross portable cooler, and we got there at 12:20 to get our pick up order and they open at 12. We were the only ones there so when I called them right away about our incorrect order it was a fiasco and they pretended not to even remember who I was! I also noticed that they pre-fill up their glasses of water for the tables at the beginning of the day and then let them sit on the counter until customers come in! The place is kind of old and dirty so I imagine the water getting full of hair and dust. My pineapple fried rice tasted like it had week old shrimp, not fresh! The pluses are that they have good Thai iced tea and they even make a cute rose at the top of the straw with the straw paper which was a nice thoughtful touch. The restaurant sits up on the top floor so I imagine great street views of Haight through the big bay windows in the dining area. I don't think I'd go again though.
author: Vanessa B.

description: I usually eat from this place every week while I'm at work, but the last few times I have ordered the quality was very bad and greasy. I even talked some of my co-workers into trying it, and it was disappointing for everyone. Delivery this last time took over 1.5 hours... with many options out there, shop around.
author: M P.

description:
I'm on my insane Whole 30 diet, no soy, no dairy, no sugar, no flour, no rice. I thought I was going to starve! Boy was I wrong, I told the waitresses and they pointed me to the curries and soups. I had the yellow beef curry and sweet and sour chicken soup. They were both really good! I love the yellow curry, I've never had it taste that good before. I added broccoli to that dish and it was filling. I have a feeling that at least one of my No foods ended up in the dishes, maybe sugar. There is no way it all taste that good without something bad added in haha.

Oh my god I had to come back to give them 5 stars. I'm eating left over yellow curry sauce and it taste even better than round one! I love their red curry with duck but this yellow curry might have won me over. Best yellow curry to hit my mouth!
author: Karen T.

description:
Extremely tasty and priced well, along with plenty of seating...what's not to like about this 2nd story escape?

We ended up here after a bunch of other, smaller local restaurants had lines - and I'm glad we did!! I went back again just a few days later...

The food here can be slightly hit or miss, but man, when it hits, it hits. We got the Pad Thai, yellow curry, Pad Ke Mow, and Ploy Vegetarian. Let's start with the highlight: 
The beef pad ke mow was the best pad ke mow I have had, anywhere. No question. Amazing. Bursting with flavor, the perfect temperature, and the perfect spice level.

Next up was the yellow curry. Definitely up there in curries I've had...I wanted to keep eating it forever, but I had to share since we were doing things family-style. 

The Chicken Pad Thai was forgettable, and had too much tofu. Pass on that.

A couple people on here keep raving about the Ploy Vegetarian, and I'm not sure what the fuss is about. Like, sure, it's delicious! But it didn't seem to have any special sauce like people suggested, and it really just tastes like great fried veggies. Delicious, but nothing to write home or inexplicable going on here.

Definitely a great little Thai place...as long as they don't change that Pad Ke Mow ever, I'll be back here often :)
author: Chris S.

description:
To a non-thai, the fare and decor felt pretty authentic. Plus you know any asian place with a number in the name must be legit, even if it's in the heart of the Haight.
It was super busy at 8pm on a Wednesday night, surprisingly and we ended up at a table in the middle of the hall. Even being so much in the way of everyone, we still struggled to get any tlc from our servers. It's sort of what I expect, though, from a legit Asian place.
author: Tina K.

description: Food was great (except the spicy chicken wings). Service was horrible. Asked for napkins 4 Times. Still waiting for them. Food was out before drink order. Will order takeout next time. Give it a try!
author: Orlando L.

description: I live in the Haight and this is spot for thai.  My favorites are the tom yum soup, pad thai, and pad se ew.  Ploy II produces good authentic food at a reasonable price.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Ploy II...the go-to for me and my roommates. The food is always fresh and delicious and doesn't have that gross fishy taste that sometimes Thai food has. Sometimes it is a little greasy but somehow still tastes really clean and we keep going back! I've always ordered delivery and they are prompt. We've ordered the:

-Yellow Curry w/ Tofu
-Green Curry w/ Chicken
-Red Curry w/ Chicken
-Shrimp Pad Thai
-Chicken Pad Thai
-Tofu Pad Thai
-Crab Rangoon appetizer (super good, not that much cream cheese, and you can see the actual crab pieces...excellent)

Like I said, everything has been fantastic and definitely our favorite spot to get Thai and we've tried a lot of places.
author: Louise Z.

description:
Was on my way home from work starving and my bus broke down in the Haight. Decided that I was too hungry to wait and walk home, so I called up my friend who lived in the area and we got dinner. 

Originally we were trying to go to Siam Lotus, but it turned out to be closed. Stumbled upon this place and it's super like your typical Asian restaurant, decor and all. I was surprised this place was in the Upper Haight. 

We each ordered our own noodle dish and wow it was like a mountain of noodles when we got them. Proportions were large and it was your standard pricing. Perhaps I was just so hungry that I actually ate so much of it, but every bite was absolutely so good. I would definitely come back here when in the area and craving Thai food. They even had larb I saw on the menu, which was pretty impressive. The staff is also really nice here too as they let us take our time and greeted us in a very friendly manner.
author: Julie L.

description: I ordered take out for dinner from Ploy II and they had the food ready in about 20 minutes from the time I called them. I must say I was impressed with the food! I had the larb gai (essentially a thai salad with chicken) and the pad thai. It was the best pad thai I have had in awhile. The portion size was generous considering SF standards. It also wasn't too expensive (there are other Thai restaurants in SF that are significantly pricier than Ploy II that don't taste nearly as good). They put just the right amount of sauce and gave quite a bit of chicken with the pad thai. I will be coming back again to try some of their other dishes.
author: Lynn T.

description: THE BEST THAI PLACE EVERRRRRRR. Yummy red curry. Tom yum. Mango sticky rice. And a cute little window seat on the top floor. Cozy af
author: Katie B.

description: Worst Thai I've ever had. It's made by Chinese folks, and the cuisine is haphazardly prepared.
author: Navi O.

description:
The roasted duck curry was delightfully delicious, and exactly what I was after. Good variety of dishes. They were also very kind to seat me only 20 minutes before closing. Sit by the second-floor window if you can, it's a lovely view.

Altogether hella damn nice, if you get me.
author: Orin Z.

description:
At first, my friend were just yelping to see what restaurants were close by. We were both craving Thai food. We went to Basil initially and found out they were closed since we were too early for dinner. We wanted to go around Haight St. and found Ploy ll. We went to Thailand recently and have really had the authentic food there. We wanted to give this place a try and we did. 

We saw a gate and thought it was closed, but it was upstairs. It wasn't crowded at all only about three tables including ours. The guy server was nice and let us choose our seating. We didn't realize how hungry we were, but knew we wanted the Tom Yum Kha, Pad See Ew, and read that the Mango Panang Curry was a popular choice. 

All three dishes were a little bit too sweet for my taste. My friend and I tend to like things a little spicier as well. I asked the server if the pad see ew could be made spicy and he said yeah. When the dish came out, it was just topped with red pepper flakes, which honestly I could've done myself. The servers were alright and polite, but could've been more descriptive. Would I try this place again? Maybe in the near future to see if they improved. Other than that, not my preference.
author: Tina N.

description: No idea what the food is like. I ordered delivery about 2 hours ago and it's sill not here. They called 20 minutes ago to let me know they were out of what I ordered. This place should not be offering delivery.
author: Claudia E.

description: Only tried one item (pad kee mao) but it was great. Very friendly staff. Cute dining area. Fast service. Food was a bit spicy but that Thai food for you.
author: Jordan D.

description: Tried this restaurant for the first time with a coworker, service was fast, pad see ew was lacking flavor and beef was a bit over cooked.  Coworker had yellow curry and also said the yellow curry was also lacking flavor.
author: Mark C.

description:
SF Korean dining has the garage restaurant Toyose / Chamse.
But the Thai dining experience gives you the whole house.
Every time I visit, I wonder where the bedroom or other den is.
Because there's got to be a Gamecube somewhere.
I didn't say Wii.
You know the Gamecube Mario Kart is still the coolest.
And as soon as my Thai friends teach me how to say all that,
I'm going to ask the servers where the game room is.
I also need a shirt like the waiters have.

Things to see:
Handwritten crayon x marker menus and signs on the walls.
Tables blocking the doorway(s) on packed evenings.
Home furnishings.

It's a cool place to bring friends for a talkative meal.
They only accept up to 2 credit / debit cards per table.
author: Dan B.

description: This restaurant is situated on the 2nd floor of an apartment building, and is quaint as though you were having dinner at a friend's. The food was deliciously authentic, with all types of spices, herbs, and roots.  I was stuffed enough to continue eating, and happy enough to have had leftovers the next day.  Service was a little slow, but I would definitely revisit during a slower time.
author: Sara B.

description:
So I have never heard of Ploy before. I could barely see it from across the street, where we stood hurting after being told to wait 1.5 hours for a bar seat. Hungry cold and poor doesn't bring out the best in people. We cut the hesitation short, it was just dinner we are not buying a house or adopting a kitten. Signage is old, stairs are narrow you make your way up and be greeted by the patron saint of fake flowers. Then something bizarre happens. You see and smell amazing food. 

We ordered the chicken green curry and prawns fried rice. Both were excellent and came to $24. Portions were large but I don't suggest sharing, couldn't stop eating past being full. Every single thing people ordered looked good, there was a fair amount of creeping happening in the name of Yelp research. 

The menu is extensive and the service is quick and friendly. I mention service because it was mothers day weekend and they were so busy and worked really hard. That is it can't wait to go back and dig into some comfort thai food.
author: Nora B.

description:
If you like soup, which I do anytime of the day, you gotta check out the Tom Kha soup at Ploy II Thai Cuisine restaurant. Your choice is either chicken, pork or seafood Tom Kha soup. Now if you REALLY like soup with coconut, this is the place to be. I ordered the Tom Kha seafood soup. I also like Po Tak soup and I always order it but thus time I wanted to try a different Thai soup.

Service was good. Everybody got their (party of 5) order in a short time. Although it took quite a long time for one of the soup dish awhile.

Price was reasonable. For a party of 5 with 15% tip included, it was about $16 per person.

I'm a big stickler for clean restrooms and their restroom was very clean and smelled good, too.

If you like Thai food that's obviously delicious and hearty feel-good food and but not pricey, ask for Jay. She's awesome.
author: Manny D.

description:
Awful. 
Food: 2 stars
Service: 2 stars 

We came here on Friday night at around 8 o'clock to have dinner. After about 10 minutes the waitress came by to take our order: pad see ew with chicken & vege pumpkin curry with brown rice. 

The food came out very quickly. The noodles were the first to come. They were brown and oily. There was nothing to this dish except noodles and chicken. There were no carrots, no onions, just terrible, definitely one of the worst noodle dishes We've  ever had to pay for San Francisco. 

The pumpkin curry wasn't any better. Pumpkin curry was made from a yellow curry paste lacking flavor with the strong taste of Tumeric. Vegetables: boiled onions pumpkin carrots cabbage broccoli. They were literally just boiled and placed on top of the curry. I mean how hard is it to use a spoon and stir the vegetables into the curry? 
OK fine so the vegetables weren't stirred into the curry and the noodles were oily and brown but it was food right? It's nothing a little bit of hot sauce can't fix. 

We asked for hot sauce, waited five minutes, then the waitress brought hot sauce to the table of diners next to us. They looked puzzled, they didn't ask for hot sauce. We asked another waitress she disappeared into an abyss and never returned. 15 minutes later we asked third waitress, two minutes went by and our fellow, diner sitting next to us passed their hot sauce onto our table. 
Then a waitress appeared with a container filled with chili paste. She made the assumption that one of the other waitresses brought us hot sauce but in fact it was our neighbor diners hot sauce. 

All in all a very lousy experience. It's too bad we wasted a Friday night dinner at this terrible restaurant. The waitstaff is only interested in gossiping at the back near the kitchen. The food is no good.  There's so many thai restaurants in the city and there's no excuse to have such poor quality food and poor quality service.
author: Reena T.

description: Just waited almost an hour and a half to get our dinner delivered. The food arrived room temp and the sodas were not cold. We ordered green curry and it didn't come with rice, so we called the restaurant and they REFUSED to send over rice, even though we are only a few blocks from the restaurant. I was told that curry doesn't come with rice.... on what planet? So after over an hour of waiting we now have to go pick it up (from somewhere else). Such BAD service.
author: Dallan G.

description: Just wanted to come back and ensure I gave yhis overpriced tourist trap NO STARS but yelp won't allow me to.  Food and service horrible.   Should not be allowed the privilege to serve the patrons of Haight and Ashbury.   Dont waste your time money here.
author: J V.

description: when im in this neighborhood, i often stop by this place for a late lunch after shopping or before going to the park, im often suprised few decent affordable eatery on height. this place the food has always been consistant, unique setting, good service.
author: Peter P.

description: Solid Thai food, a family restaurant located up a flight of stairs near the end of haight street, worth stopping by if your in the area.
author: Zach J.

description:
Hidden Gem!! This place is a bit hard to find if you don't know where you are going, even though it's on a major street. I wasn't sure what to expect going up the tiny staircase into an upper Victorian story of a house but to say I was pleasantly surprised would be an understatement! 

So far, I've been there 3 times and each time everything ordered was a hit with everyone at the table. The standard pad Thai and pad see ew were perfect, satay well done, spring rolls super fresh and the Thai iced tea- delicious! But my favorite so far was the lemon chicken: it's served on a bed of fried spinach with a sweet citrus aioli. Rich, but very satisfying. 

Good price point for what is being served and chill Thai style service make this my Thai go-to-spot in this neighborhood.
author: Alex W.

description: The food is good - Tom yum was delicious; fried rice was also nice; pad thai was a bit too sweet though. Authentic thai food. Service a bit slow
author: My Anh T.

description:
Shopping for vintage attire got me hungry, so I was on the prowl for lunch.  Ploy II had their menu street side.  I passed it once, but some intuitive voice said, "go there."  Am I ever glad!  
The restaurant is located upstairs in what appears to be a home.  The dining room features a bay window overlooking the street.
I ordered the spicy tofu combination.  Hard to choose a dish because of the wonderfully extensive vegetarian menu!  My meal came with rice, a fried wonton and a soup that featured tofu.  It was some of the best food that I have ever had.  They serve beer and wine as well, which is nice.  And, good service.
My only regret is that this place is not located in Charlotte, NC, where I live.
author: Robin C.

description:
Awesome Thai place in Haight-Ashbury area! 
We had the chicken pad thai - good food, ambience and service.
author: Parakram K.

description:
This is my absolute favorite Thai place in the city! I've been here over a dozen times the last few years which considering the many options in and around SF I think is a lot. 

My go to dish is the Panang Curry. Delicious! I want some right now just writing about it.

If you're here with another person, you can easily share dishes and still have leftovers to take home.

The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. 

The ambience is warm and a good place to take a date. If you are on a date, try getting a seat by the window for a good view looking down on Haight Street.
author: Czar Y.

description: I have eaten here before, but this last time (last week) I was so surprised to notice how dirty the space really is. I asked the server for condiments and got a green plastic basket covered in old spilled chili sauce and soy sauce, and the plastic containers with the sauces looked like they had not been cleaned in 2 years! I COULD NOT BELIEVE MY EYES, and I will think twice before returning to this place! Not a good experience.
author: Flora O.

description: I've eaten here numerous times. It's a safe choice if you wanna eat good healthy food at a humble environment. The menu options are pretty versatile, the atmosphere is friendly, the wait staff kind and accommodating. The place looks like it's somebody's apartment and you're treated like the guest of honor. The food is delicious and affordable. You're not gonna be overcharged nor gonna eat something you won't enjoy.
author: Safak O.

description:
My go-to Thai in my neighborhood.  Delivery most days.  Closed until dinner-time on weekends.  Dine in or Take out or Delivery.  I'm a fan because I've gone here 10+ times and every one of those times have been delicious. The women work hard, the cooks serve the fresh food up, and it's really cute space (A victorian home remodeled into a kitchen/restaurant.

Favorite Dishes:

Pad Se Ew (with Egg)
Chicken Satay (Appetizer I think?)
Tom Kha
Coconut Curries (All of them)
Garlic-Pepper Shrimp (get a side of rice to soak up all that garlic pepper sauce!)
Everything else
Seriously, Everything Else.

Will add more to the review if I think of it.  If you are within walking distance, get your thai here, not at *that* other Thai place!
author: Cat A.

description: Don't be afraid to walk up the random staircase. You'll find an awesomely strange converted residential space with tasty food. Personally, their panang curry is great.
author: Eric W.

description: So Good! So very good. Their Pad Thai is the best in the Haight. Everything I've ordered is always fresh and full of flavor.
author: Jay L.

description:
I work nearby and have been exploring the Haight for good lunch spots.  This restaurant was in range and I absolutely love Thai food. I love this cuisine so much I could eat it nearly every day of the week without fatigue. 

Despite being open to most of the standard dishes, I nearly always order a Thai iced tea and either pad thai or pad see ew. Today I had the pad thai and it was wonderful. The sauce was full of flavor and there was a good balance of chicken and tofu to noodles.  I scarfed my lunch down within 5 minutes. The lunch serving was perhaps slightly small, but I'm not left hungry by any means. The Thai iced tea was rich as well and didn't last more than a couple minutes while I was waiting for my order to go. 

I can't comment on the atmosphere as I took my lunch to go, but it looked similar to most Thai style restaurants with a bit more of a homey mom-n-pop vibe. 

I gave this review 4 stars, but may bump it up to 5 after checking it out a few more times for consistency.
author: Russell S.

description:
Ordered online via Yelp's Eat24 service. Was told 45-60 minutes time. 

Contacted Yelp after 60 and was told that restaurant still needed more time (really??). 
Food finally came after 90 minutes.

Pad Thai was not spicy, as requested. In fact the chicken tasted like it was cooked separately and thrown in at the end. Imperial rolls were not very good. The Pad Kee Mao Noodle was tolerable.

Overall, I was very disappointed with the experience. This is the 2nd time I've had problems with Eat24's order fulfillment and I doubt I'll be using it again. I don't think I'll order from this place again as well. There are better options in the city.
author: Dan W.

description:
We ordered delivery from Ploy II on multiple occasions during our year long stay in SF so it's definitely good enough to keep us coming back.

The delivery portions are easily enough for 2 people and even have extra for a second meal. We would order the Pad See Ew (I recommend asking for extra vegetables), mango sticky rice for dessert and their yummy thai iced tea each.

Thanks Ploy II for the year of Thai yumminess!
author: Bethany S.

description: The food was delicious, served hot and quickly with care. My need for vegan options was accommodated with kindness and the prices were very reasonable. Nice atmosphere and a view overlooking Haight Street, if you like. Going back every chance I get.
author: Jenine-Lacette D.

description: Our delivery items were gross. Curry was overcooked w vegetables total mush and forgot the tofu. Basil pork didn't have any basil in it! Second time in a row I've been disappointed with take out.
author: jen c.

description:
Overall the food was good. But due to the service and lack of transparency, my experience was not so great. Couldn't find prices online and ordered basil chicken, seafood combination and tom kha soup. They quoted us at 15-20 minutes and didnt tell us a price. When we arrived 20 minutes later and told them our name they had to "search" for our order. 5 minutes later and she brings me a bill of 35$ out, I double checked that this was for my order and she said yes. I was surprised that 3 items cost this much. We end up waiting another 15 minutes for our food. We didn't get a receipt either.

The basil chicken was good. The seafood combination we ordered only came with meat. The Tom kha was good. 

I'd go back for the food but their service could really improve.
author: Zoe S.

description:
Cute restaurant located upstairs in its building. Very small space, which makes it intimate and romantic even, but they can accommodate large parties (we were a party of 6 and there was another large part next to us).

The food was very good and authentic, but nothing too spectacular. I ordered the pad Thai, which was just tart and sweet enough and they were generous enough to toss in tofu and a meat. I also tried the green curry - it was flavorful, but the beef was kinda chewy. I also got the fresh young coconut, which is always delicious. 

Service was kinda slow and they kept mixing up our orders. 

Would come again, but nothing to write home about.
author: Mark T.

description: This restaurant is such a cute place! You walk up stairs into this adorable seating area where it is nicely decorated with hanging lights and a view of haight street! The service was good, and the menu was huge! I ordered the cellophane noodles (vegetarian and I forgot what it is actually called on the menu whoops) and it was so delicious!! The portions are huge and the price is very affordable (especially for the amount you get). All in all, if you're looking for an interesting spot to go to for some delicious food, this is your place!! Will definitely go again. Two thumbs up!
author: Julia O.

description: Ploy II is my favorite Thai place in San Francisco. It is a quaint, upstairs location with great staff and a charming Haight St vibe. I love their panang curry, fried rice is amazing, and you really can't go wrong!! I would recommend eating there any day.
author: Kayla T.

description:
My friends were up visiting from LA and we wanted a place to get a bite to eat on a Friday night, sans a long wait near Haight Ashbury. I'm so glad we found this place. We walked into several restaurants before going upstairs to Ploy II- most places had an hour wait or more. Our table of 6 was seated immediately and we received great service. Very cute restaurant, nestled inside of a house. Colorful string lights in the bay window and lots of little tables of people enjoying good food.

I tried and enjoyed the green curry with vegetables, fried wontons, a noodle dish whose name I have already forgotten, and the beef salad my boyfriend ordered. Yum! Everything was tasty and the beer was very cheap here. Would definitely come back in the future. :) Thanks yelp, you helped us find yet another great Thai place.
author: Dan N.

description: Solid Thai place! It's cool that it's in a victorian on the 2nd floor. Great ambiance and feels very San Francisco. I like the pad see ew the best. Will be coming back.
author: Ryan Y.

description:
We stopped here on a whim before catching a roller derby game at the Kezar Pavillion (Go, San Francisco Bay Bombers!!).  Looking for a quick bite to eat before the game, we walked through the Haight, and my bf actually recognized Ploy II as he had eaten there before.  He remembered that it was really good so we took a chance and went upstairs.  Cool authentic decor, very homey and comfortable and score! We got the last table for two that was open!  It got quite crowded quickly as we could see it's a popular dining spot!  

Upon going to a new Thai restaurant together, we always get the pad see ew with chicken as a good comparator.  It was flavorful and yummy - definitely one to get!  Plus, we got deep fried pumpkin - sounded so good.  It was a-ok.  I love pumpkin, but I think I would rather have it cooked plain and not fried.  We still enjoyed it though as it came with a nice tangy sauce for dipping.

Friendly service and our meal was yummy but quick, which was just right for us on this eventful Saturday evening.  We were happy and full and ready to see some roller derby!  Thank you, Ploy II !  By the way, I didn't ask, but where is Ploy I? ;)  You probably get that all the time, but really, where is it?
author: Maile N.

description:
This is a family owned restaurant! We love it. My husband and I love thai food and this is really authentic and delicious. The prices are reasonable for SF. I don't mind paying more for good quality of food. We ordered the tom yum and phad thai, the shrimp was so fresh and the herbs and spices they used were the perfect combination, we felt like we were back in thailand eating these yummy food. The staff was so nice as to refill our waters constantly, and even scoop our soup for us. We love the thai fish cakes, yummy! 
Go support these! LOVE THIS!
author: Suri R.

description: We had the Pineapple Fried Rice, Yellow Curry with Tofu, and the Vegetarian Spring Rolls. We requested tofu for our fried rice which they gladly accomodated. The curry with veggies and tofu was amazing as was the fried rice. I would definitely come back here the next time I'm in the Haight!!!
author: Lauryn R.

description: REALLY unhappy tonight. Came for my birthday and my favorite menu item was missing; found it named something else, and learned that it has ALWAYS contained OYSTER SAUCE. The dish was in the VEGETARIAN section and called PLOY VEGETARIAN. I was extremely upset and ordered it without the oyster sauce, and it was very disappointing. I am heartbroken that I've been deceived for 17 years now! I've asked in the past and was always told it was vegetarian, but oysters aren't vegetarian. My favorite food of all time is now something I won't be eating.
author: Jessie A.

description:
I recently moved to the Upper Haight all the way from Washington DC. Within the first few days of being here, my roomates explained that I needed to establish the local haunts I would be frequenting. Ploy II was the one they recommended I try first. It's one city block away from my front door. 

I walked to where I had been directed and noticed the inconspicious sign hanging amidst a few other dirty, strange business signs. I turned right to find a small nondescript door, that looked very residential, and proceeded up the stairway. I was immediately greeted with a smile and a menu for take-out. I ordered the red curry with chicken and the drunken noodles with pork. The prices were very reasonable and the turn-around time was swift.

Upon getting home and opening the bag, I knew that Ploy II would be a major problem in my life. The next fifteen minutes are hard to recall in exacting detail, but I can say I remember coming out of the my food-induced ecstacy only to refill my beer and shake my head in disbelief.

Fast-forward four weeks, I've had Ploy II AT LEAST once a week since being here and can't imagine ever lessening that frequency. I would recommend this place to anybody with a penchant for good Thai food and a tongue. 

YES!
author: Chase M.

description: This place was fantastic. Still need to try a few dishes to make a final decision, but for the first time- I LIKE!
author: Michael S.

description:
If decent music played, this place would get 5 stars.

I'll forget that my pad thai was missing fish sauce, that the tacky Christmas decorations don't need rehanging, or that the tables are crammed in to fit as many diners as possible even if that means putting a customer in a working doorway. (I sat there.)

The food is good and plentiful. Now after the third time dining here, I bring my own take out container. Less waste, plus they make you pack it yourself anyway. Since there is so much food, it's like having 2 meals, or makes it cheap for two people to share an appetizer and a main dish.

The service is typically Asian (not including Americanized Chinese): food comes when it's ready. "Appetizer" just means it's prepared before other dishes. Women servers wear ethnic skirt sets and bus the same tables they wait on.

I've never had a bad meal here. My favorites are the spring rolls and mango panang curry. The pad thai is pretty good if they remember all the ingredients. I ordered it out of a comfort food craving. (Wish I had pasta someplace else instead. Except the only pasta I'd want isn't in the neighborhood.)
