Charming atmosphere; it's in an old Victorian and you feel like you're sitting in someone's house -- except there are great Thai masks and decor around. 

The food was quite good, especially the Tom Yum soup. My wife likes to judge Thai restaurants by their Pad Thai, and she professed it the best she's had in San Francisco. I second her recommendation. 

Oh, and almost most importantly, the prices were shockingly low. Every entre we ordered cost less than $13.
author: Ron E.

description: I first started going here back in 1998, moved to LA, and every time I come back to the city I make a point of coming here.  Hands down some of the best Thai food I've ever had, with the sweet charm of a home-style business.
author: David C.

description:
Great intimate ambiance in the upstairs of an old Haight st victorian house. Good quality standard Thai cuisine. Decent prices. 

Great place to take a date, trust me!
author: Peter B.

description: the food here is really, really good  it's savory, not greasy, and totally satisfying.  what they lack in ambiance, they make up for in quality. seating is kinda tight but the service is good.
author: Eliot J.

description: This place is decent.  They have good lunch specials and have always been good.  I like their curries a lot.  They aren't my favorite Thai place in the city, but I feel like the Haight doesn't have the greatest selection of Thai restaurants.  Of all the Thai places in the Haight, this one is definitely the best.  The soup they serve with the lunch deal I'm not crazy about but I do like their curries a lot.  I also like the fact that they are slightly removed from street level and are above the street - it makes the eating experience feel a lot more intimate and peaceful.  Definitely a good place to stop for lunch in the Haight.
author: Heather K.

description: Love this place. Good prices and good food in a unique upstairs dining environment. Delicious curries!
author: M S.

description: My step-dad found a huge fly frozen in an ice cube. After he had finished his drink.
author: Rhi G.

description:
I love this place...as if I don't already love so many other things in the Haight-Ashbury district.
Kudos to whoever decided to put awesome thai food near a stoner mecca like Golden Gate Park.
This little thai joint is kinda on the small side, but once you sit down and check out the menu, the size of the restaurant won't matter. Everything on the menu looks good, it will take you some time to decide. A friend and I shared a couple things -all totally amazing-  but  I think my fave was the panang chicken.
OMG-zee, that stuff was a-ma-zing.
For dessert, we had friend bananas. Totally tastey, I highly recommend it. Be careful, they're hot, they can easily burn the roof of your mouth.
The service was good. Not super warm and friendly, but the waitresses get their job done and make sure that you arer satisfied with your meal.
author: Chelena G.

description: This place is not that great. The service has been less than par every time I've been, and I've given it three chances. Five minutes to take a drink order, five more to get the drinks and then running away before we could give you our food order makes it hard for me to want to tip you the 20% I always leave. The curry is mediocre, and the eggplant in it is soggy, slimy and just plain gross. Also, the green curry isn't green? Wtf..  The tea is just a tea bag in a cup of hot water, which is kind of lame. There are definitely WAY better places in the city to enjoy Thai food.
author: Sarah S.

description: Now I RARELY try anything new, but was in the mood for something soupy and Thai.  Mmmm, Mmmm good.  Twas not disappointed.  One must always get the 007 vision on when entering an establishment where you must walk up a flight a stairs, but fear not.  Friendly staff, good food and if you get a window you can watch all the other freaks and geeks walking the Haight Street corridor!
author: Bruce R.

description: This place was a little hidden gem. I tried the green curry and I fell in love. Try to get here on off-hours if you can though because it fills up and the place is pretty small and can get cramped. I haven't tried a lot of different Thai places in the city but so far, this one has been fantastic.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
I had a GREAT impromptu lunch at Ploy recently.  I think I was craving noodles, and some studly local suggested we try out Ploy II (where's Ploy I anyway?).  Easy to miss, it looks like the entry to someone's home tucked in the store fronts of Haight.  Except this person posts a menu of what they cook and they invite you up to have some.  Awesome.
Totally homey, quite literally, with tasty damn food.  The fried pumpkin appetizer special was awesome, and our pad thai came with these crazy bizarre little pork fluffs on top.  (I guess it's called meat floss, which I love, but pork fluffs works too:  http://chowtimes.com/2006/05/21/shredded-dried-pork-aka-meat-floss/)  We were totally unsure of what it was, other than weird and delicious.  The Thai Iced Tea was right on as well.
Sure I may have had to pay for the privilege of dining at this friend's house, but at least they didn't expect me to do dishes.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I love this place!  its right down the street from me and it is fantastic.  The mango panang curry with prawns can not be missed :)
author: Nicole T.

description: Yum. Definitely one of my favorite spots to get Thai food in the city, either for dine in or carry out. The restaurant itself is a fun spot to get some good Thai, the delivery and take out are speedy and conscientious. I adore their Tom Kha soup. Prices are right. All in all a good spot.
author: Emily M.

description: When we walked in, the place was pretty full, which led me to believe that it would be great.  The food wasn't bad, but not spectacular either.  I think it catered to the western palate a bit more that I desired.  The noodle and rice dishes that we got weren't void of flavor by any means, but just didn't have a spicy or pungent kick that I was hoping for.  I suppose it's good for those that are just being introduced to Thai food, but if your a Burmese man like myself, then you may want to pass.
author: Damon Z.

description: Damn they can fry up some tasty tofu! We ordered the spicy tofu appetizer and it was delicious, not very spicy but still yummy! I had the praram with tofu, I was impressed with how many veggies came with this dish. Their peanut sauce was also very good. My bf had the spicy tofu combination, it was also loaded with veggies and definitely was spicy this time. We ordered for delivery and was quoted at 45 mins, it was here in ~20 and very hot! I was also able to order a thai iced tea to-go! I really wanted the spring rolls but they were sold out by 6:30 :/
author: Cori W.

description: It's a super cute restaurant.  Service was good.  I just wasn't impressed by the food at all.  We got 4 dishes and only 1 was good.  Siam Lotus across the street is definitely better.
author: Michelle B.

description: You have a horrible name; an unassuming doorway from a world of sneaker wearing boys and their more masculine counterparts. Incidentally, your door might come unhinged with the wrong sort of breeze killing that delightful couple strolling by. A friend believes it's all down to nurture, but my insistence for nature will bode better with their Darwinian decline. You've been naturally selected to decease, kind sirs - oh and hello dears, do mind the gap between the dead boys and the entrance.
author: Marc M.

description: This is the best authentic Thai on Haight St AND they deliver!! I love me some CClub but they don't deliver and this is more authentic. The fresh spring rolls(yum!), soups, curries - try them all, you can't go wrong!
author: Gwen V.

description: This little 'jewel' is tucked away towards the end of Haight.  If you're not familiar with the area - you might just pass it by.  The restaurant is on a second floor - clean and decorated with ferns and bamboo handwares.  We ordered lunch and had a wonderful meal comprising of the black bean fish with ginger and bbq chicken.  I wish I saw the yelp reviews otherwise- I would have tried the pumpkin appetizer or the shrimp with mango...Service was prompt and amiable :-)
author: Arissa C.

description: I think the Haight Ashbury is severely lacking when it comes to Asian food .  Which is kind of ironic, since there's 3 Thai restaurants on Haight in between Masonic and Stanyan.  This is third one that I've tried and although I wanted to fall in love with the Victorian architecture in this restaurant (it literally looks like someone's home), I just couldn't get down with the dishes.  The chicken satay was good after I assembled the chicken, the sauce, the scallions, and the cucumber.  The fried chicken wings were good, but honestly how can fried chicken ever be bad?  And the pad thai lacked a strong flavor and was overpowered by the abundance of bean sprouts.  This place will be fine for the occasional week night when I don't feel like cooking and want some quick takeout, but I can't say I'll be back here often.
author: LaSha G.

description: Deeeelicious Thai! I ate plenty of local cuisine in Thailand and took a cooking class there as well, and this place is definitely one of the more authentic Thai places in our city. I also love the house it's in. You do get a fun view of Haight Street from their few window seats. I have had nothing but good service in authentic garb and tag this as one of my favorite Thai restaurants. Oh, and if you want wine or real flowers, go somewhere else. There is nothing but excellent Thai here.
author: Dave R.

description: 5 stars for the panang curry alone...it was my first panang, and no other panang has ever compared.  I've enjoyed the other dishes that I've tried, and like omfg they have $9 carafes of house wine.  $9!!  Did you hear me say $9?!  You can have a really fabulous meal AND get drunk for an incredible price.  I love it!
author: Angela M.

description: Ordered the Papaya salad and it was wasn't that good.  It was one of their specials so I figured I'd try it.  It had too much papaya and not enough sauce or flavor.  I ordered the Green curry with chicken which was tasty, but nothing special.  The service was unfriendly because they were busy and the waitress looked like she was pissed off.  I like the place because you can sit by a window on Haight overlooking the crowd, but it's kind of small with low ceilings so you hear all the conversations there.
author: Mitch A.

description: Do not order from here. I always have to repeat my order numerous times because their phone in the kitchen where they take orders is ridiculously loud. I have given them several chances despite the fact they haven't gotten my order right once, based on the fact they are so close to my house and hoped they would deliver quickly. However, this last time took the cake. I ordered 2 drinks with my meal, paid for them, asked the delivery guy if there was 2 in the bag, which he replied yes, but of course there was just one. I called them to have them bring the forgotten drink and they told me 45 minutes. Seriously? After arguing with her that I am only a few blocks away and my dinner would be long cold after 45 min, they brought me the drink. However they tried to get me to pay for it AGAIN. After explaining the situation to the delivery guy, he started to actually get heated and was extremely rude and aggressive...over a coke.  These people have serious issues if they can't figure something this small out.  Considering it was a Sunday night and I didn't have the energy to deal with something so silly, I want to make sure no one else suffers either. Call elsewhere, the food is pretty mediocre anyway. Your Sunday night is much better spent on pizza and Desperate Housewives...
author: Betsy C.

description:
someone wrote something about not getting chopsticks in an asian restaurant; i dont think thai restaurants really set them out for use, its more of a chinese/japanese/korean thing, really.

anyhow ive been coming here for years and the food and service (although sometimes slow) has been consistently good.  the owner always greets me in person, checks up on our meal. refills our drinks..

the ploy prawns and garlic pepper beef are to die for.  the fried banana with ice cream, not so much.  i much prefer narai's version.
author: Kimby T.

description:
came here last weekend on a recommendation from a friend while exploring san francisco.  the food was fantastic, but service was not the best.  not sure if that is the norm here or not.. we waited about an hour to be seated (there were only two people ahead of us in the waiting area) and then about another hour to be served.  since we were very hungry at the time, it almost caused us to leave, but luckily we stuck around.  

the food was worth the wait.  we got the spring rolls, red curry chicken, and the spicy duck entree.  all were great, with the star dish being the spicy duck, without question.  i can't recommend this dish highly enough.  portions were good as we took some to go boxes back to the hotel and finished them off a few hours later.  some of the best thai food i've ever had, though i had to be patient for it.
author: Matt C.

description: One of my favorite places to eat in the upper Haight.  Like some of the other reviewers, I like it as a break from the hectic Haight scene.  It's also quite reasonable for a place on Haight.  Try some of the specials that are posted on the walls!
author: Roger L.

description:
My mother used to live around the corner while a student at UCSF, and this was her favorite restaurant. After going here with her, and without, over the years, it's definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the city.

The food has always been consistently good, with an exceptional array of tasty vegetarian dishes. The traditional silk thai dress and friendly service lend a welcoming air, and the unusual ambience of a 2nd floor victorian makes this spot unique. Highly recommended.
author: T.J. K.

description: Love it.  Great service, great food. My favorite pad thai around. It feels like you're at someone's house and the adorable little Thai hostesses are bending over backwards to make you feel welcome and full of delicious food.
author: Cassandra W.

description: Ploy II offers great Thai food for a good price.  Easily the best Thai food in the Upper Haight Street area.  It is on the second floor of its building, so if you are having trouble finding it - look up!
author: Matthew H.

description: You'll find very friendly service at this Upper Haight Thai joint, along with very good food and hearty portions--I couldn't stop eating!  It reminds me a lot of Thailand Restaurant in the Castro; where the second floor dining area gives you a view of Castro St below, Ploy II gives a prime people watching view of Haight Street from above.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Of the maybe 20 different Thai places I have tried in the city, this one is my favorite. Excellent food, great atmosphere and nice view. The best Pad Thai I have ever had and the vegetable param in tasty.
author: Scott M.

description: Best of Thai is pretty much the McDonald's of Thai restaurants, Ploy II is indeed an adult step up. I would not order the pad thai but instead stick to other dishes, my favorite is the spicy beef or tofu with lots of fresh veggies and just enough spice. Smaller portions than I'm used to and a little more expensive than it should be, but it's still a very nice take out option for us Upper Haight citizens.
author: Maria D.

description: Ploy II is the best. try the Panang Curry! Best Thai place for the price. Staff's great too!
author: Rodney D.

description:
Terrible when it comes to ordering food over the phone for pickup or delivery.  We have had two terrible instances.

First one, I called from work on a weekday at 5 pm to place an order for pickup. The guy tells me it will be ready in 15 min.  I told him there was no hurry since I was commuting from downtown.  I "assumed" the food would be ready when I arrived 45 min later.  Nope, they had not even bothered to start it.  Not happy, but I let that one go.  

A few weeks ago, I ordered food on a Saturday night at 8 pm and was told that it would be 45-50 min for delivery.  That was fine and sounded right for a Saturday night as I knew they were probably busy.  An hour later, at 9:00 pm I called. They had not even started my food and told told me it would be another 30 min.  I was very angry and said that was unacceptable.  I asked to speak to the manager and yelled at her for the delay.  I asked her why the guy told me 45-50 min if it was going to be longer.  Why could they not be honest or call me and tell me of the delay?  All she could say was that I could cancel my order if I wanted and that they were very busy. I raised enough of a ruckus that she assured me that my food would be there in 15 min.  Sure enough, it was, but it was terrible.  This place use to be great.  I do not know what has happened, but beware of the guy that answers the phone.  Be sure to clarify that he is telling you the truth.
author: Donna M.

description: I love this restaurant! When I can get it together to get dressy for dinner, the dining room in this place is awesome, in an old victorian house upstairs and seems sneaky hidden which adds to it's charm.  The staff here are always very polite and sweet.  I typically order the chicken mango panang curry, which is offered all the time, though it's always on the specials menu and not regular menu.  Regardless, it's always perfect, and we do take away often.  I can't really recommend anything outside of the mango curry, but it's the best i've ever had, and I spent two weeks in thailand eating my way through each city.
author: Holly H.

description: A great find. Came here with friends who are longtime fans, and found the food to be great for the price. Good amount of spice, high quality ingredients. Only downside was the service - spotty and slow, and our food came out at random intervals so the last person to get his entree was left without food for quite sometime. This was on a busy Saturday night, so perhaps it's better on slow days. In any case, I will be back - tasty Thai for the money!
author: Beth T.

description:
yum, yum delish! im so stoked to be back in upper haight so i can eat ploy II all the time! 
although i will miss visit in lower haight, ploy II delivers for when im hungover and lazy or i can walk the two blocks and sit in their cozy upstairs overlooking the street. 
the tom ka gai soup is my favorite. but i always have to bring someone who will eat those blacky mushrooms for me. i always feel like they will come alive like some fantasia creature and start dancin on my plate...but thats just me...
author: Gabrielle k.

description: I like the living room ambiance so this place fits my style. Great food, and the environment is about as cozy as it comes. Probably the best Thai in the Haight.
author: Chris B.

description: I haven't eaten at a large number of Thai restaurants, but the food at Ploy II is fantastic.  I think I could have the Beef Salad every day if I weren't concerned about the health consequences!  The Pad Thai is always very good; and the Chicken Param is really wonderful if you like cooked spinach and peanut.  Delivery is in the stated time, and prices are medium.  I plan to remain a loyal customer!  Yum!
author: Valerie H.

description: I've been here about five times. Each time was a pleasant experience. Food is good and the price is right! Sometimes the food comes out super fast and sometimes it takes a long time.  I have had the egg rolls, chicken chow mein, and the duck curry.  Good portions and the staff is very friendly.
author: Karlie N.

description: I really like the atmosphere here. The restaurant is on the second floor of an old victorian on Haight street, and all of the original charm of the flat is still present. On top of that, they cook up some of the best Thai food in the city - their pineapple fried rice is particularly fantastic, as is their larb, their som tum and their curries.
author: Mark H.

description: This place probably deserves a 3 or 3 1/2 based on the quality of their food alone, but I give them 4 because of their quality of service & consistently friendly disposition.  It's always a pleasure to go there, be it for sit-down or take-out.  It's a simple, little place: more like eating in someone's living room than in a restaurant.  I like having such an inviting, homey place in my neighborhood.  Cheers, Ploy!  We love having you in the neighborhood!!!
author: Eric H.

description: I am a big fan of Thai food and this place has made a big fan out of me.  The food leaves me satiated with spice, flavor, and fill.  The prices are extremely reasonable.  The people who work at Ploy II are friendly and if you are lucky enough to get a view looking down on Haight St. it adds a novelty to the dining experience.  Ploy II has a distinct charm that provides the feeling of an intimate meal with friends or by myself.
author: Erin F.

description: Love the Panang (sp.) chicken!!! That's the main reason/dish that we crave when they deliver to us.  It's so "silky" and smooth in taste that it really leaves you feeling fulfilled with regards to your taste buds and wanting more.  The delivery is fast and the prices aren't too bad either.  Give 'em a try!
author: Scott S.

description: I have had some very yummy dishes here; in season their mango and sticky rice is a personal favorite dessert of mine. I have also had some bland, uninteresting dishes. I have never had anything bad or inedible, but I have had shrug worthy meals here. Their pad thai is decent, and the corn fritters are tasty. The fresh rolls are better at the citrus club a couple doors down the street.
author: Aimee B.

description: I didn't even realize this place was right on Haight Street- it's a nice surprise! It's cozy and calm- well, I feel more peaceful after having been there. The service is really fast, even on a busy night, and the prices are very reasonable as well. The food is pretty good as well....and they deliver too!
author: Barbs J.

description:
really good food. the pumpkin appetizer made a non pumpkin fan a fan. the spicy tofu platter is very good - although you smell like it for the rest of the day.

a little cramped, i try to get seated by a window to avoid panic attacks.

service is quick and friendly. food is fresh and tasty. one of the only sit down places worth visiting in upper haight.
author: Allegra F.

description: Good. Homey. Paid in cash and waitress didn't give us change...I guess she presumptuously assumed the leftover was tip.
author: Erin M.

description: Great place if you enjoy painfully slow service, a lack of cutlery and being completely ignored. I have been here twice. The first time I sat at a little table with a plate of noddles, an empty glass of water and nothing to eat with (except my hands.) Last night I decided to give Ploy a shot again and ended up leaving after sitting at a table for 20 minutes while being ignored...not even a drink order!!
author: Kathleen E.

description: I like the upstairs location.  A great place to bring tourists to eat in the Haight because it's above all of the street level grimy bullshit down on haight, but still totally authentic located in the second story of a victorian.  Again, hard to get rowdy in a place like this because the place is intimate and there is normally someone within earshot who doesn't want to hear your sailor mouth, but hey, if it's good, say so.  We got three meals, ended up splitting three ways with white rice, and the portions were more than enough.  Good deal.
author: Amy M.

description:
This is excellent Thai food. We have been coming here for years and it really is some of the better stuff in this part of town. One small gripe is the service - one time we were actually told to leave cause we apparently were staying longer than they wanted and there were people waiting.
But overall, this is one of the best places for Thai food in town.
author: katrine H.

description: Best Thai food in the Haight: 3.5 stars.  Usually fairly quick to be seated and served.  Not a great date place or worth a trek from across town, but definitely a local spot to grab a bite if your fridge is empty.
author: kathleen A.

description: Excellent delivery choice in the Haight. We had the mango curry. Delicious! and the Pad See-Ew. Delicious too. They have brown rice too which I love. Definitely a good option.
author: Nikki T.

description: I loved this place when I lived in the Haight. I've lived in Thailand, and this place reminds me of being there. That may have more to do with the decor and the sweet Thai ladies who work there than anything else, but, still, Ploy II makes me happy. The food is pretty good. I recommend the specials and the veggie stuff.
author: Leigh M.

description: The price is right the food is delicious, unfortunately it is usually hard to get a table on Friday and Saturday nights, but they do quick take-out service too. I highly recommend Ploy!
author: Alex S.

description: My friend swears by this place but I'm not a big fan of the fake flower decor and the food (both the sweet and sour chicken and chicken pad thai) have been medicure in my opinion.
author: Jared F.

description: Love. This. Place.  I've ordered takeout 3 or 4 times now, and recently ate at the restaurant itself, which was a great experience. Loses one star due to oddly mushy prawns the last time I ate there, but that was probably a one time thing. Everything else that meal was incredible.  Best Thai I've had in the city, hands down.
author: James G.

description: When my husband and I are hankering for some good thai, we ask each other "up"? Up meaning that the restaurant is upstairs in a cool old Victorian. It feels so cozy like being in your own living room which so happens it is. The wait is never too long-we usually go on a weeknight but one Friday night, the staiway and the landing were packed to the gills with hungry patrons. But we waited for only about 15 minutes. The food is always good ,fast,and hot. The tom yum soup is the BEST! Usually get it with prawns but just with veggies is good too. It's just so good on these COLD nights. The chicken with silver noodles and yellow curry with seafood are my favs. Oh and their fried corn cakes are to die for too! The service is always warm and friendly.
author: Karen C.

description:
What a great place to have around the corner. 

Good food....friendly service.....converted flat.....as quick or as long as you make it. Everything is good, reasonably priced, and the portions are nice sized.

I love the pumpkin curry, but i say that about almost every Thai restaurant, so take from it what you will.
author: Kaveh A.

description: The service was good, the food was good, blah blah blah, etc. Did anyone see the sign in the bathroom? "DO NOT [underlined] flush such things down the toilet!" No indication of what said "things" are, just the strictest warning I've ever seen! I was so overcome by the hilarity that my laugh was audible to the people I was sitting with. Someone please confirm that this sign is still there.
author: Jordan S.

description: we had the veggie praram and the spicy tofu combo and i really enjoyed it. the food here is really delicious with very nice presentation, not at all the typical cafeteria platter aesthetic you see at a lot of thai restaurants with similar prices. i love the atmosphere of the restaurant as well. it's quiet, they play nice music and being in the upstairs of a victorian house looking down on haight street is great for people watching.
author: Jane P.

description: The food is decent for the price, but the service is among the worst I've experienced north of the equator. I can't say for certain, but I'd imagine that you'd get slightly better service at your county correctional facility. They are understaffed, only visit your table if you basically rifle a plate across the room to get someone's attention and be prepared for a 4-5 hour wait for your check.
author: K F.

description:
On the positive side, this restaurant has a nice location near Amoeba's, is located in an interesting location, has cheap-but-OK glasses of wines, has a fun casual atmosphere, and is generally less expensive than other restaurants on Haight.  The service is amateurish, but friendly.

On the negative side, the food is really, truly mediocre.  The wait staff is Chinese, and I'll guess the kitchen is as well, as most of the foods on the menu are entirely reminiscent of a cheap American-Chinese dive.  And the Thai specialties are just weird.  The second time I went, I saw the staff unload crates and crates of Skippy's creamy peanut butter, oddly enough.  

I then had the red curry, and understood - the red curry is basically a peanut-butter sauce.  It is not spicy or flavorful, and not really anything reminiscent of Thai cooking.  I'm OK with that, and I enjoy many other completely un-authentic Thai restaurants.  But peanut-butter curry is just past my limit.
author: Jeff R.

description: We just ate there tonight and it was exactly what the doctor ordered for the day after ... (yes, this was New Years Day detox). Food is great, not over-greasy like some Thai restaurants I could mention, service tiptop, and I love the upstairs location - its like being in someone's living room. Try and get a table by the window for Haight Street people watching ...
author: Richard B.

description: We ordered from Ploy II on a Thursday night at 9:30.  I reviewed the Yelp postings and was quite concerned we'd never get our food.  Where the lady told me it would be 30 minutes, the food arrived in 20.  Nice delivery guy too.  I'm not sure if they've changed their ways or it was a good night, but I'd recommend them.  Good Pad See Ew - not Thep Phanom or Marnee Thai but very good.
author: Sheila B.

description: We love this place -- it is consistently tasty.  Our favorites are the papaya salad (best in the city) and the tom ka gai (chicken coconut) soup.  Delicious!
author: Patricia S.

description: Unfortunately, my favorite Thai place in the city has just become my LEAST favorite. I called in an order for delivery and was told there would be a $5 delivery charge even though I live a 5 minute drive away and have never been charged before. Regardless, I agreed to the charge and was then practically hung up on. An hour later, no food. I called to check in and was told my order is on it's way. An hour and a half later no food. I called again and was told the delivery person left 30 minutes ago and it should be there soon. Two hours later, no food. I called again and was told that my order was never placed because I did not agree to the delivery charge (which I did agree to). Interesting that I wasn't given this piece of information on either of my previous two phone calls! Ploy II has always been slow, but not rude. I won't be ordering from here again.
author: K C.

description: Love it...a little greasy, but still love it
author: Craig E.

description: For some reason I seem to end up here on several birthday dinners. The food is great, reasonably priced. They seem to add alot more vegetables to their Yellow chicken curry dish than any other Thai place that I've been to. It would rank 2nd to Menora in my book in terms of thai food in SF. If you're going for ambiance, I wouldn't expect much from this place. But the food is excellent, and with a few Singha's Thai food goes down great.
author: Srinivas R.

description: This is the first place I've been that was clearly a converted apartment. Very cozy inside. The food was great and I really felt at home, because it was a home. I'd recommend. it.
author: Roderic C.

description: Love this place!! Best to go on a weeknight when it's not too crowded. We got a seat next to the window with a view of Haight Street which is great people watching ;) And the food is outstanding... my favorite appetizer is the spicy tofu. Best Thai food in the Haight.
author: Terese S.

description: Basically, you eat what you're paying for.  I usually leave satisfied in the money-department (most lunches are around $6 and come with main dish, rice, soup and greasy fried triangle of something?) but with a pain in my gut.  The pad thai is so greasy!!! but somehow tasty.  The curries are too sweet.  So is the pad thai for that matter.  Most of the dishes taste the same, like they use the same sauce base and add a little something to each dish for "variety."  The location is nice, in an upstairs apartment overlooking Haight street.  Good for people-watching, especially if you get a window seat on a sunny day.  The only reason I keep coming back is for the good prices, but the last time I sortof felt like I was going to die.
author: Allison G.

description: This is a cool place.  It's in an old Victorian on the 2nd floor.  It's nice to dine and look outside, perhaps on to a bum-fight in front of the Red Vic.  The food is always very good.  There are always some specials going on, though they just seem to rotate by day.  All in all a nice place, but sometimes the service is a little scatter-brained.  Not like it's MY fault there's not enough room on the table to fit the appetizers AND the entrees all at once!
author: Ken B.

description:
I thought the food was just terrible; but I guess that's what I get for not looking at dish recommendations on yelp.

We had some duck soup and a pork dish with peanut sauce over veggies. The soup was just like pieces of duck in beef broth, not that good at all. The pork wasn't that tender and there was way to many veggies. Peanut sauce is one my favorite things in the world, and I didn't even think it went well on this dish.

On top of it all, we ordered bowl of rice to share between two people. The server came and put a little bit of rice on each plate, and then charged us both for rice. $1.50 each for a handful of rice is a bit much. 

I guess overall the food is cheap, so I'll give it 2 stars instead of 1, but I wouldn't come back unless I was stumbling around haight drunk and desperately looking for food.
author: Jeffrey T.

description:
I was absolutely floored by the Mango Panang Curry. Get it. All else is secondary - yet still delicious. 

Stopped in recently while wandering the Haight. Got a nice table by the window.

Ordered:
Deep Fried Wonton's (6 crispy tasty wonton's filled with spring onions, and a sweet and sour dipping sauce). Good opening appetizer.

Mango Panang Curry with Chicken.  Absolutely amazing and unique blend of flavors. I've never had anything quite like it before. The mango added a smooth and sweet flavor to the panang. Superb.

Pad See Ew with Beef. This came after the Mango Panang Curry. Still good, but after the majesty of MPC, nothing could compare.

Service was good, food arrived as it was finished, which I personally prefer. Good location, nice atmosphere. Definitely would come back.
author: Ford P.

description:
I like this place. Tried their pad thai which I think is better than most thai places and their spicy fish. The thing is when I ate a piece of fried fish without the sauce on it it tasted like totino's pizza. i was like omg.......this is so weird....

I also got hte mango with sticky rice. It was my first time trying it and I didn't know the sticky rice was hot I almost burned my tongue...there's some coconut milk drizzled on top with sesame seeds...mm the mango was ripe and tasted good....
author: Crum B.

description:
RE: delievery
read good reviews of the place on yelp, got the heads up that delivery might be slow, but still underestimated how long it would take.  would have been better if they just would have said it'll take more than 2hrs and we could've planned around it.  i expect the food will be at least aight (if/when it ever arrives), but check yourself before you request delivery.
author: A G.

description: My favorite Thai food. Adorable atmosphere, like a bed-and-breakfast almost, a real cute spot for a date... lulls in conversation easily filled by commenting on the hooligans on the street below. Cute waitresses in Thai dresses. DELICIOUS food. One complaint: they don't fill my water glass often enough.
author: Sabrina S.

description: Average Thai food for cheap.  The Papaya Salad was good but the curry was only so-so.
author: Aileen N.

description: The place is consistently good. (And walking distance!) The other reviews are right -- Thai places in the city are a dime a dozen. And, if you've spend more than a few weeks in Thailand, then you get to know the difference. Yes, some are cheaper or some are swankier, but really Ploy tops them all. Great service as well. Loved the chicken curry with noodles. It wasn't as spicy as I'd have liked it but it was good for everyone in the group. For newbies to Thai food (hey, there are some!) the pad thai here is perfect!
author: joann p.

description:
i'm kinda partial to marnee thai, i do have to admit, but sometimes i'm just not in the mood for some "exuberant" and "vocally gifted" owner, so ploy II works too!  

yes, it doesn't beat the fly-infested food stands in bangkok, but i'm on a health kick now, and i'm trying to minimize my time in the bathroom, so eating in a converted house will have to do.  food was good, although maybe the salmon with peanut sauce wasn't the best idea.  hmmmm, maybe that's why i haven't ordered fish with peanut sauce before.  it's just not right.....but, they did the best they could with it.  it's generally good stuff though (maybe 3.5 stars, but the staff was nice, even though they were clearly trying to get us to finish our dinner pronto....), and if you get a seat by the window, you can check out the peeps trying to sell the kind to unsuspecting tourists, which is always good for a laugh....
author: Miss P.

description: I feel a little guilty as I almost never intend to go to Ploy II, but end up there semi-regularly when heading to Citrus Club and finding a wait for a table.  Ploy II is good in it's own right.  It has your typical menu for a San Francisco Thai restaurant and that's not necessarily a bad thing.  While not earth-shattering, the food has always been good.  If it were slightly closer to my house, I would go here more often, as well as Siam Lotus.  As it stands, I usually just go to Thai Place II because its 2 blocks rather than 15 minutes from home.  However, I would give Ploy II the nod for being better.
author: Zach J.

description:
this place is the reason why i now love thai cuisine.

sticky rice!
author: Rosalee C.

description: This is a fantastic Thai restaurant and I love coming here. The menu has good variety and everything is delicious and well prepared. In addition it's very well priced! What more could you ask for?
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Ploy II is consistently delicious!  My wife loves the Pad Thai with shrimp and I love the curry duck!  The wait staff is always friendly and helpful.  Delicious appetizers like the corn cake and satay.

Thank you Charlie and Sumi!
author: Gary L.

description: I haven't even actually eaten here, but had a terrible customer service experience. Ordered delivery and was told 30 minutes...An hour goes by, I call to check on it and am told 10 minutes...Another 30 minutes go by, I call again and am told 10 minutes. I say forget it, it will have been 2 hours since I ordered my food and I'm barely a 10 minute drive away from the place. I say I want to cancel my order, the woman passes me to someone else, who asks if I want to cancel. I say yes, and she says okay and just hangs up the phone without another word. Today I go to pay my credit card bill and notice they still charged my card for the order! Never had such a bad delivery experience in my life honestly. Will definitely be contacting them for a refund, though not too hopeful based on my first encounter.
author: Gary S.

description: The best, and only, place for Thai food in the city. Thai places are a dime a dozen, and this one is definately not one of those. This restaurant is not about the ambiance.... it's about the foooooooood. Which they do amaaaaaaaaazingly. Roast Duck Curry?? Who does that? And who does it well??? Ploy II.
author: Megan D.

description: It feels as if you are eating in someone's kitchen - quaint!  I really like this spot but I don't care for their pad thai (although I stand alone in this assertion, but I prefer savory/spicy foods to sweet).  The pumpkin dish is unique and fun and I always start with the spicy tofu (although a tiny bit too caramelized for my preference).  Nice selection of thai beers.  Ploy II is a cheap eat on Haight but easy to miss because of it's small doorway.  Go early so you won't have to wait.  Sit near the window and look down on Haight for some fun people watching.
author: Nadia B.

description:
it was cold outside. 
we were hungry.
upper h8 doesn't have too many options for quick but non-greasy food.

hadn't been to ploy II in about 6 years. 
remembered it was good and not too greeeezy.
we both ordered noodle soups and the two of us ate for about 20 bucks. 
it was yummy and warming and a nice familiar feeling walking upstairs to a place i hadn't visited in years.  
great view of h8 st from the windows.  
yes, i see you smoking pot mr. panhandler with no shoes sitting outside cold steel.  fun times.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
i really liked this place before and now that i live in the area, i absolutely LOVE IT! probably the best thai food in town... it can get busy and the place is small so i suggest you make a reservation if you're going during peak times. 

try the deep fried pumpkin - it's heavenly. i love the mango panang curry and the spicy tofu dish... their noodles are good, but i think i've had better noodles elsewhere. but their curry and entree dishes are to die for!!! and kicking it back with a cold singha in a frosted glass - priceless :)
author: Lucy C.

description: I've only been here once, but the experience was perfect from beginning to end. I made a reservation, and they kept us a very nice window table. The place was packed to the gills, but they kept our water and tea full, and had our food to us within 15 minutes of ordering. Our food (eggless pad thai for my husband, pumpkin green curry with sticky rice for me) was excellent--many Thai restaurants overcook the veggies in curry and/or completely overpower the flavor of the pumpkin by making it too spicy, but this was just right. The bathroom was very clean. Highly recommended.
author: Ramon E.

description: I had dinner delivered from here, which was a bit of a long wait but it was a Saturday evening, and it was worth the wait. Panang curry has a little bit of spice but not too spicy, and the vegetarian pad thai was delicious. My friend enjoyed the yellow curry. The curries came in large containers, which made me happy because I'll get to enjoy them for at least one more meal!
author: Dina S.

description: Good, no-thrills, inexpensive, fake-carnations-at-every-table kind of place. You can get a good amount of food for just under six bucks at lunchtime and a peppermint patty and no-smiles waitress for dessert. But for the price and the odd, yet quaint upstairs Haight Street location, what more can you ask for?
author: A Y.

description: Good Thai food. I love anything with coconut milk in it. Cozy upstairs seating. My friend and I got a nice seat by the window overlooking the Red Vic theater across the street.  Very sunny during the lunch hour on a clear day.  worth checking out.
author: Ed M.

description:
How do you end a day of drinking and bluegrass?  With Thai food and more drinking, of course.  Ploy was tasty, and I'd return in a heartbeat.  It's a cute space... the whole victorian thing works... but I still prefer Marnee Thai.

The mango panang curry was tasty with its large chunks of tender mango... albeit sweeter and less spicy than I would have liked.  The duck was also appropriately moist and delicious.  Solid food but not quite OMG best thing evar.
author: Alex Z.

description: This place is truly a hidden gem. It's easy to miss as you have to walk up a flight of stairs to enter the restaurant - but just look for their sign on the sidewalk and don't pass this place up.  Lots of folks hype up Citrus Club (which is a few doors down on Haight) but C.Club does not hold a candle to the tasty dishes at Ploy II.  I highly recommend the garlic pepper beef over rice.  There are tables by the window which lend to a great second floor view of Haight Street.  I will say that if it's busy, you may feel like you're being rushed a bit by the waitstaff - but overall they're all friendly.
author: Peter M.

description: I have eaten here a million times over the past 8 years.  And I still love it.  The veggie pra ram is my favorite here. My girlfriend usually gets the pan nang curry and she just loves it.  Also, the corn fritters are AMAZING. The only reason i dont give out 5 stars to this place is because it's closed on like mondays or tuesdays? something weird. I always forget and then go there and bam, it' closed.
author: kristen n.

description: Excellent Thai food. Their praram sauce is the best in San Francisco. Nice decor overlooking Haight Street. This place is an easy five stars.
author: Chris P.

description: I love to come here for dinner on the weeknights.  It gets a little bit too crowded on the weekends and the delivery option usually takes quite awhile.  Though there are probably a thousand good Thai restaurants in the city, this place always ranks highly with me and has what I would consider to be a "normal" Thai menu.  I have tried many different dishes from their menu and have never had something I didn't consider absolutely delicious. The Tom Yum Gai is my absolute favorite, I have never had better anywhere!
author: Dani C.

description: terrible. especially the service. do not order delivery from these people!  they will forget about your order, and then when you call to remind them that you ordered food 2 hours ago, they will be rude to you.  the haight is lacking in good thai options. you are better off going to one of the better thai places in other neighborhoods in the city. I used to think they were ok but after multiple bad experiences with the service never again. the people there are not friendly at all.
author: Dylan C.

description:
best thai food in san francisco!
a little more than I would like to pay, but the food is worth it.  my favorite is the mango penang curry! the pad thai is awesome too.
 the service is  great and very friendly. 

mmmmm can't wait to get my delivery tonight! yes they deliver!
author: Nicole E.

description: What a pleasant surprise. We ordered in tonight after we found Ploy II on Yelp. Delicious, fresh and lightening fast delivery! We enjoyed the pumpkin curry, pad thai and spring rolls. Yum.
author: Samantha L.

description: They take forever to deliver, and its always sub par. Asked for chicken pineapple fried rice, it came with sketchy sausage, gross chicken and other strange tid bits (raisins, cashews, onions, hairy burnt stuff from the pan). The woman on the phone screamed at me in broken English and did not meet any of my requests, they charged almost $30 for 2 entrees and an appetizer. Last time I'll ever order from here.
author: Christopher B.

description: 3.5 stars. The service is usually pretty good. A bottle of the house red is great and cheap! The peanut sauce is OUTSTANDING on the Khak salad!!!!!
author: BLAH B.

description: Tasty fried tofu appetizer, okay vegetarian pad thai.
author: Mike W.

description: I eat Thai food all over this city and this is my favorite place. I theorize that this place gets a fresh stock of spices for their kitchen straight from Thailand on a regular basis. The food tastes like this to me. Only go here if you want to eat really delicious Thai food. Service is Thai (i.e. smiles, friendly, and quick). The place is a real deal.
author: Kincl M.

description: I've been missing real Thai food ever since visiting Thailand a few years ago.  Although not as good as the vendor stalls on Soi 57 off Sukumvit Rd in Bangkok, its pretty close.  The Panang curry is my favorite dish.
author: Gabe F.

description: This is the best Thai place in the city.  The restaurant is a little crowded as it's situated in a top level flat on Haight street.  But it's a fun time and delicious food.
author: Sarah C.

description:
The food itself is pretty decent and so is the ambiance of the cozy dining room.  However, their kitchen is small and ill equipped to handle the amount of business that they do.  They really need to expand and probably do some re-organizing/cleaning house.

They were out of thai iced tea (which tastes good).  They were out of fresh spring rolls.  We ordered vegetarian tom kha, which was okay.  Nice texture and consistency.  I prefer mine a bit more sour and a bit more sweet a bit more salty but all in all the taste was decent and creamy.  We also ordered vegetarian pad see ew.  Again, the taste was actually good, smokey and the tofu was nicely done but I think they must've run out of ingredients because there was no egg (: ( ) and they had used the pad thai noodles rather than the flat, thick, chewy ones I'm used to.

I'd say the food gets around 3 stars.  The ambiance also gets 3 as well.  The people who work there are nice and the hustle and bustle of the back room takes me back to Thailand, however, the service sucks.  Do not order food for take-away.  You will be sitting and waiting A LOOOOOONG ass time.   You may get your food faster getting it delivered from Bangkok.  Yeah.  Serious.
author: erin k.

description: ok i was little skeptical about this place but one of my roommates recommended it. so i thought i would give it a shot.  and they did not disappoint me. the food was really yummy. we ordered chicken satay, noodle curry, duck curry, and shrimp with garlic and black peppers. they were all delicious. the servers were all really cute too. they were dressed in thai traditional dresses. the price wasn't bad. we all got beers. and we paid like $22 each i think. i liked this place!
author: Te R.

description: I went to eat here for the fist time ever last night. Let me tell you something about the Haight. People are extremely snobby in most stores and restaurants. Not this ONE! We were greeted with a smiling woman who seated us right away and brought out one of the best Thai curries i have had so far. The decor was a little bit too much for me. Very cramped and small. It's cute but i like very open spaces for Restaurants. That's just my taste though. That's the only reason why i rated it 4 stars instead of 5. Nevertheless i loved it.
author: Waheguru Singh K.

description: so i ordered delivery without seeing the bad yelp reviews about it, so i got a little scared it was gonna be a bummer. but 46 minutes later, my food showed up piping hot and pretty dang tasty. i was completely happy with my delivery service from ploy ii and they will definitely be my thai delivery jam from now on.
author: holy c.

description: The BEST Thai food in the city.  The owner is kind and attentive and if you're even a semi-regular she remembers you and most likely will remember your favorite dishes!  Whenever friends come from out of town this is one of the first places they want to go.  Ploy II is not to be missed.
author: Robin G.

description: I've been here twice and i will keep coming back. I ate there on my first visit the service was attentive and quick and the food was awesome. tonight i took it to go. the woman ringing me up was very quick and made sure i had napkins and flatware before i left. Once again i was not disappointed. the spicy duck was tender and delicious as was the panang curry and the perfectly ripe mango with sticky rice.  I've been to other thai places where the food was as good but the prices here are much more reasonable. i highly recommend this place.
author: greg j.

description: The food was great, but the delivery service was as previously described- IT SUCKS!!!!  We waited 1 hour for our food that didn't come with the rice we ordered, then waited all night for the rice they promised, but it NEVER came!!!
author: Jennifer S.

description: After coming to Ploy II for about 10 years, I noticed something different.  It seems as though Ploy II is under new management or ownership.  Possibly because I was so freaken hungry I did not noticed this and expected to be served an entree portion as I was not aware that during lunch they ONLY serve the lunch special.  When the small portion of food arrived we complained that it was not what we ordered and that we expected the entree size.  The lady said it was lunch time and that they only served lunch specials and that an entree had to be specifically asked for.  I thought we were asking for it... but accepted the meager portion as it was as we obviously were not getting what we wanted.  We had ordered crab fried rice and beef param.  I was very disappointed with the portion size and the quality.  The soup is visually unappealing consisting of just water, boiled vegetables, and carried a pungent aroma.  The beef was tough and spinach tasted like a freezer.  We ate both dishes and wished we had eaten at McDonalds instead as we were not as full as we would have liked.  After this experience my boyfriend and I have sworn never to go here as it has turned into a tourist trap.
author: Bunny F.

description: it's a little small and cramped inside, but they have damn good pad thai (but the portions are a little small).  i also noticed the other day that they have free delivery...maybe i should hit that up since the 5minute walk to marnee can be sooo laborious at times :P!
author: Roshni R.

description: This is by far the best Thai in the city.  Everyone I have ever taken here has become an instant fan.  The dishes are great and prices beyond reasonable.  My only negative is sometimes the wait staff can be slow on the refills and service.  But hey in the end its all about the food!
author: Mark D.

description: Any restaurant that will put up with me and a few of my friends (including one who thinks he's an alien) hanging out past closing time without dropping "not so subtle" hints about leaving automatically gets 2 stars. Ok, so putting up with my "alien friend" gets another star, lets be honest. On top of THAT, they accomodated my strange ordering technique in a nonchalant, happy way and I ended up with a super duper tasty spicy ginger tofu dish that was finger lickin' good. And I think the decor is lovely. Do people even know how many restaurants are converted apartments all around the city? We sat around talking about their assortment of horns above the fireplace and the symbolism for hours.
author: bloopie s.

description: This is my favorite spot to get out of the chaos of the upper Haight and have a comfortable meal.  They are upstairs so you are removed from the crowds and into a usually welcome quite atmosphere after walking the Haight.  The food is excellent, though not quite the best Thai in town and they always have friendly service.  While their beer and wine selection could use some improvement, the food always comes thru.  Their seafood is fresh and well prepared and I'm a huge fan of the Roast Duck Curry (spicy) too.
author: Dave S.

description: This place is upstairs and really cute.  The ladies also wear cute Thai-style dresses.  It's a bit cramped though.  We ordered papaya salad, egg rolls, 2 Thai beers, 1 Thai iced tea, tofu pad Thai, chicken pad seew, and green pumpkin curry.  I thought everything tasted really good, except the pad seew.  It didn't taste bad, but I asked for it to be spicy, and there was no spice.  I really liked the green pumpkin curry.  It was mildly spicy (I really like my spicy!!!), had good flavor, and the pumpkin was really yummy!  I did get annoyed, though, because the waitress wasn't helpful.  We asked for silverware/plating (there weren't enough places set), water, and chili sauce, and we didn't get anything/took forever.  She just ignored me!  Also, they kept giving us plates with food, but took forever to take the empty plates (and our table was small!).   I'm not sure if the service wasn't too great because of a language barrier.  Maybe they couldn't understand me?  Overall, I would probably go there again, and probably order curry.  I definitely wouldn't go for the service though.
author: Candiace A.

description: This place popped up on the "Welcome" page and I was immediately transported back to 2004. I was living in the Haight with my best girlfriends (fellow Yelpers Diana S. and Linsey P.) and Ploy II was the go-to joint for Thai. Not all Thai, actually. Just Panang curry. Chicken, to be exact, and you had to ask for added bamboo shoots, because that was just the secret recipe for happiness. Warm, coconutty, spicy, delicious happiness. I turned Diana onto it and there began a period of time Linsey refers to as our "Panang Days". We were so addicted, between the two of us there was rarely a night without Panang or leftover Panang in the house. (The portion is quite large, almost enough for two full dinners.) Linsey would come home, smell the Panang from the hallway outside the front door, and groan, "AGAIN???" We would merely shrug, sniffle from the spicy nose-run, and dig in. What could we say? We were addicted. Try it at your own risk! But don't forget the bamboo shoots.
author: Madie S.

description:
i don't know how this place has managed such good reviews. i've had waaaaaaaay better thai food, and the service i received was LOUSY. 
i ordered the yellow curry and vegetarian curry puffs. the curry puffs were "mediocre at best", but then when the yellow curry came it was all down hill. it tasted tomato based for some reason and came out looking all orange. my friend ordered the silver noodles which i sampled and whose taste didn't warrant the amount of grease they were covered in. She and I didn't eat more than three bites (literally) of  our meal cause it sucked so hard!
  i decided i didn't want to force myself anymore as i really was miserable eating it. i wanted to gather up my courage to not pay for the food since i only had three bites and really did not enjoy it at all. i've never done this before in my life, but i actually told the waitress i didn't like the food or want to pay seeing as how i could not actually eat it because i did not enjoy it. i NEVER DO THAT. i felt really bad actually because i didn't want to be a bitch. she told me she would ask her manager. 
he came out in like 5 minutes and started yelling at me. i kid you not, he didn't even look at my plate and said "you already ate more than half of it". this was a complete lie. my bowl was still FULL, since obviously i only had three bites. then he told me "i'll let you not pay for it this time, but don't do this at other restaurants", this was after yelling at me for a couple of minutes at the top of his lungs in front of the whole restaurant. all i could muster up was " i didn't eat more than half  of it, that's a huge lie, and i don't need you to teach me etiquette". i was not even being treated like a human being, and its not even like i was trying to get a free meal, i didn't even eat the food, really! i left this place hungry.

I still can't believe this night happen. It really sucks to go to a place and get yelled at by someone who works there after trying to eat their disgusting food.

one star for the thai iced teas which were the only thing besides the decor that didn't suck balls.
author: Yvonne Q.

description: Such great neighborhood Thai restaurant. No joke - delivery is slow. This time I got take out and it was ready in 10 minutes! Yum!
author: Julie H.

description: I have been to at least 25 Thai restaurants in the City and this one has by far and away the best green curry. The service is above average but the thai food is better than Marnee and 30% less expensive. I take all my out-of-town guests there and they swoon. I also suggest the mango prawn panang. Seriously, for the price, this is the best Thai restaurant in the City!
author: Steve B.

description:
This review is purely here to inform what type of business you are about to support. I had carefully looked at there menu you online knowing that I have severe food allergies now I dont know about you, but I have never had zuccini in yellow curry and I know this because it is a safe food for me. When ordering my food the woman there are rude, I realize that it is busy however, you do not have to be rude I am giving you business. So after the food arrived I opened up there yellow curry and the thing was covered in zuccini when I called them to see if something could be done about this considering on there online menu it does not say that there are zuccini in there yellow curry I was pissed. They told me that it was not there problem and to not eat it. Duh I am allergic to it. I feel that if you can be somewhat understanding of food allergies then maybe you should not own a business. By the way it is also against the law to put something on your menu and give people another. I hope this has helped people. Like I said nothing against there food, it is purely for the business you want to support.

http://definitions.uslegal.com/f/false-advertising/

Ps. Have fun dealing with my lawyer.
author: Bella P.

description: extremely good, I had their pasta special and choose spaghetti with peanut sauce and chicken.
author: Elizabeth A.

description: their noodle curry with vegetables is one of my very favorite things to devour in this city.  everything else looks so yummy, too, but i can't help but order this every time and it always tastes even better than i remember. also it was really, really cold today and they were serving hot instead of iced water. kinda funny at first but then seemed to make so much sense once the spicy food arrived.  they just really have it going on here - full flavored menu and chill, homey decor. i feel like i've been invited into someone's home in thailand. wanna take my shoes off and stay a while.  great to take yourself on a solo date.
author: E M.

description:
go here often as I am often in the Haight

service is usually rushed...  the older lady owner, is quick to take your order but also quick to get you out...

last time they forgot about us for over an hour, seems like they are understaffed in terms of the wait staff...  too few wait staff for the number of tables

food is average..  ok if you are in the area otherwise nothing beats Manoras in SOMA
author: Fredz R.

description: cute spot in the haight .  i like ordering my food and sitting by the window to people watch.  never a dull moment in SF!  okay back to food - praram (peanut sauce flavored chicken or tofu over spinach) is good. pad thai could use some work where it lacked tofu, sprouts, and other toppings. not the best thai food but one of the better thai spots to eat in the haight.  eat here to get your fix of food. then, cross the street to get your music fix at amoeba. :)
author: ally o.

description: Ploy II is one of our favourite sopts in the city....I love the homey ambiance and the authentic food.I recommend the Panang Curry with pumpkin or Mango....Pretty much everything I tried on the menu was good.For their prices,I'm shocked to see people expecting 5 star service....It's a family run business in an apartment so when you are there you can't help but feel at home,so try not to expect a fast efficient service,just chill relax and enjoy the moment :)
author: yarah b.

description: this place is sort of like if one day i woke up and was like, hey, i'm going to turn my apartment into a thai restaurant.  the place is sort of hilarious.  but i have to say, the food was a lot better than i was expecting.  we played it safe - tom kha gai, pad thai, green curry with chicken, and it was all pretty good.  it's within walking distance for me, so i'd definitely hit it up again.  if i were getting in the car, i'd probably go to manora.
author: brian g.

description: strangely, after working in the haight for 2 years, i had never eaten here. then one day i came and was like, wow! it's like being in someone's living room. pretty awesome and interesting setting for a meal. we came here for lunch and they have a quite a bit on the lunch menu. it was yummy, tasty, inexpensive and was great for catching up with old co-workers. overall, it's much better than best of thai down the street, a place in which my friends have sworn off of because people get food poisoning there.
author: Melanie C.

description: this second story thai place feels intimate, yet laid back. friendly service and tasty dishes that represent traditional thai food. tofu can be substituted for meat in most dishes.
author: Alex L.

description: i've only been here twice in the 6 years lived in SF; however, not because it's not good. it's purely location. i rarely find myself in the upper haight hood around dinner time. took a date here a couple of weeks ago prior to a movie at the red vic. yeah, pretty standard date - dinner and a movie! anyways, the restaurant was very good. might up it to a 4 stars once i've tried a few more dishes on the menu and if they're to my liking.
author: James J.

description: One of the few places I like in the upper Haight.  Actually, I LOVE this place.  Charming, inexpensive, typically little or no wait, and great tasting food.  I've been going there for about 14 years and I think it's the best place in upper Haight, and definitely one of my favorite Thai places in the City.  I've been eating a lot of the duck curry lately.  Yummy!
author: Jeremy R.

description: curry is excellent. prices are great. servers are nice. looks like they transformed an apartment into this restaurant. pan nang curry, yellow curry, and singha!
author: Kelly L.

description: my king loves the curry sauce. good service.
author: Lady O.

description: I had been to Ploy II @ the recommendation of a friend...all good eats tasty food experiences until I took my boyfriend here & we BOTH got food poisoning. The restaurant that night stunk of the sweaty homeless kids who were eating there & the food actually tasted sweaty as well...Will never go back & do not recommend this place.
author: S M.

description: I ate at this place several times during the day, because of their great lunch special. The food was always decent, except for the obviously freezer-burned tofu. But the price was right so I kept coming back. Then the other night, after not having gone ein a couple years I brought a friend there for dinner. We ordered our food, it came fairly promptly, and we started eating. I had ordered the spicy fried tofu, and my friend ordered the fried chicken wings. After a couple bites I noticed the tofu had an eery chicken taste. Since my friend had ordered chicken I figured they must have fried them together...being a vegan I havent had chicken in years so i had my friend taste it to make sure I wasnt imagining things. She agreed, it tasted like chicken...it even had the same sauce as hers! So I asked the waiter about it...she at first said there was no chicken, then after I grilled her longer she admitted it was cooked together...when an older guy (i think her boss) said there was definitely no chicken in it. Suspecting they were lying I raised the stakes by telling them Im extremely allergic to chicken and if I ate it Id get very ill. Thats when the truth came out....they WERE cooked together! Then the guy tried to make light of it, and acted very rude and patronizing to me, not taking me seriously at all. At that point I decided I had had enough, told him off, and that I thought it was pretty messed up they would call something vegetarian, cook it with meat, then lie about it...and THEN tell me that they thought I wasnt *that serious* about being vegetarian! (this is also after I had double checked to make sure they didnt put fish sauce in the tom kha!) So, if you dont mind restaurant staff that lies to you, or a place that looks like they havent cleaned the floor in about a decade, then go to ploy thai 2! (on a side note...I understand some restaurants cook foods together like this, but the fact that they tried to cover it up and lie takes the cake...so if youre vegetarian dont eat here...or if you have any allergies..they may just lie about the ingredients and youll get sick!
author: John G.

description: Ranks right there with Marnee Thai for best Thai food in SF.  Tear this place apart my friends.
author: Dean A.

description: I don't know what to say about this place... is it someone's apartment?  or is it a restaurant??  The decor is horrible.  If you haven't come here (and I would recommend you don't), you wouldn't know that it's a second story San Francisco Victorian apt with wood panelling "thrown up".  The service was horrible (how are we not going to get chopsticks or a fork at an Asian restaurant) and the food was just tragic..
author: Mari K.

description: Eat here and you will be happy.  Best pad thai in the city.  Good service, clean bathroom, great low prices.  The Thai place just across the street cost 50% more.  Try it next time you go to Goodwill which is just on the corner.
author: Rona M.

description: I've lived in the Haight for 3 years, and go to Ploy 2 on a regular basis. And all I have to say is that this place is one of the best spots to eat at. I know a lot of people on here have said that the interior of ploy 2 is a let down, because it feels like your in someone's living room. But, that is what makes this place so unique. As for the food, it is AMAZING. Simple, yet bursting with flavor. They give you so much food, that I ALWAYS end up taking some home. And with that said, their food tastes fresh and delicious even after a day in the fridge. To all those yelpers who go to the citrus club which is just a few feet away.....shame on you, the citrus club can't touch ploy 2.
author: James P.

description: it got cool points for being in a renovated apt. but then the cool points get deducted by the hideous decor and cramped layout. in terms of food, nothing was that great EXCEPT the deep fried pumpkin. oh-so-DELICIOUS!! unfortunately, my mediocre experience was ruined by a guy sitting at the table next to us who was so loud that i couldn't even hear my date that was sitting next to me. DAN, if you are reading this, you are a DOUCHEBAG. why is it that at a large table full of people, your voice was the ONLY voice i ever heard?? you need to keep your fat mouth shut and learn not to scream "fuck" and "shit" at a restaurant. i feel sorry for your girlfriend. and your mother. and i feel sorry for the whole restaurant that had to listen to your entire conversation with your parnassus-folk friends. by the way, if you're reading this and aren't sure whether you're the dan i'm speaking of - you're white, have light brown hair, wear black rimmed glasses, and you had on a light brown plaid shirt. and you are a jackass.  mazeltov!
author: eve l.

description: this is my favorite local thai restaurant. i can go here and get almost anything and know that i will enjoy it. the pumpkin curry is especially great!
author: Brian D.
